At the Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology, we encourage collaboration with others for greater and impactful innovation.

22 May 2025 Fasilkom-TITerima Fasilitas CSR Wifi Corner dari PT Pertamina Gas Negara

Fasilkom-TI USU received a CSR Wifi Corner from PT Pertamina Gas Negara to enhance campus connectivity and support academic activities for students and faculty.

06 May 2025 Class Visit from SMAS Sukma Bangsa Lhokseumawe to Fasilkom-TI USU

Fasilkom-TI USU hosted 105 students from SMAS Sukma Bangsa to introduce its academic programs, campus life, and opportunities in computer science and information technology.

05 May 2025 Fasilkom-TI USU Promotes Integrity Through Anti-Corruption Awareness Program

Fasilkom-TI USU held a socialization on Integrity Zone to build a clean, corruption-free campus, with Cholina Trisa Siregar as the speaker.

15 Apr 2025 Fasilkom-TI USU Hosts Public Service Excellence Training for Administrative Staff

Fasilkom-TI USU held a Public Service Excellence Training to enhance staff competence in delivering professional, user-focused, and high-quality administrative services.

22 Jan 2025 Tim Rodent Watch USU Raih Juara di Asia-Pacific Global Health Innovation Hackathon 2025

USU’s Rodent Watch Team wins Asia-Pacific Health Hackathon 2025 with cross-disciplinary AI innovation to predict and prevent zoonotic diseases on a global scale.

12 Dec 2024 USU's Fasilkom-TI Picks up Prestigious Awards at USU Awards 2024

Fasilkom-TI USU earned multiple awards at the 2024 USU Awards, including international and national student achievements, and top accreditation, showcasing its commitment to excellence.

At the Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology of , we have been providing high-quality, world-class education and research since 2012, as well as serving the requirements of our Nation for highly educated human resources, which is expected to own the ability to anticipate and adapt to the needs of Indonesia Emas 2045.

On behalf of the faculty and staff members, I am delighted to welcome you to the Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology (Fasilkom-TI) of .

Dr. Maya Silvi Lydia B.Sc., M.Sc.

The Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology of is a leading institution dedicated to excellence in education and research. It equips students with cutting-edge knowledge, fosters innovation for successful careers in the digital age, and contributes significantly to regional technological advancement.

Explore the vibrant academic community at our university, which welcomes international students with open arms. Embrace a dynamic learning environment with diverse backgrounds that enrich the academic experience. Join us in fostering cultural exchange and understanding as we build a supportive global community. Welcome to an all-inclusive educational journey at our university.

The Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology of offers various laboratories and facilities to support your study and research.

More about Laboratories and Facilities Data Science, Smart System, and Software Laboratory laboratorium This laboratory, located in the Computer Science Building D, is one of the research laboratories students use to work on final assignments and research based on software, data computing, etc.

arrow_forward Computer System, Network, and Security Laboratory laboratorium This laboratory, located in the Computer Science Building D, is one of the final project research laboratories students use to work on final assignments and conduct research based on networks, computer systems, and computer security.

arrow_forward Computer Vision and Multimedia Laboratory laboratorium This laboratory is located in Building C of the Information Technology Study Program, which is one of the final project research laboratories that serves to research the field of Computer Vision such as AR (augmented reality) using HoloLens and VR (virtual reality) using Oculus, Meta Quest, etc.

About Us Education Research Community Service News E-Magazine Faculty News Faculty Agenda Faculty Announcement Faculty Article PPID Executive Faculty Leader Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology

The leadership of the Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology of the consists of Dean and Vice Deans, who are tasked with managing the faculty as a whole, overseeing the implementation of education, research, and community service, as well as strengthening relationships with alumni and the general public. general public. The Dean is elected by the Chancellor and serves for five years, after going through an election process at the level faculty and university level. The following is the composition of the leadership of the Faculty of Computer Science and Technology Information for the period 2023-2027:

Maya Silvi Lydia Dean Fakultas Ilmu Komputer dan Teknologi Informasi

Dr. Maya Silvi Lydia was inaugurated as Dean of Fasilkom-TI for the 2021–2026 period. In the same year, she was awarded as one of the best online education lecturers at USU. Dr. Maya Silvi Lydia — who was born on January 27, 1974 in Medan— received her bachelor's and master's degrees from Universiti Putra Malaysia (UPM) and her doctoral degree from . Dr. Maya is very active in practicing the Tri Dharma of Higher Education. She teaches various subjects and has graduated more than 80 people from . In terms of research, Dr. Maya has experience as a presenter at national and international scientific seminars. In addition, Dr. Maya has carried out many community service activities. She chooses to be herself and puts forward an attitude that can create change in a positive direction.

More Romi Fadillah Rahmat Vice Dean 3 Fakultas Ilmu Komputer dan Teknologi Informasi

Mr. Romi Fadillah Rahmat, born on March 3, 1986, in Jakarta, he completed his Bachelor of Computer Science (Hons) in 2007 at Universiti Sains Malaysia, then he continued with his master degree in Science at the same university. He is currently pursuing his doctorate at . Starting his career as a permanent lecturer at from 2010, Mr. Romi held the position of Head of Information Technology Undergraduate Study Program from 2017-2021. His career at the university continued after being appointed as Secretary of Academic Senate USU for the period of 2019-2024. Then in 2021 he was appointed as Vice Dean III for Research, Community Service, Cooperation and Information. Previously he was also trusted as an ITE expert by most of the police in the North Sumatra Region. Mr. Romi has also been an expert and consultant for NGO Caritas for the Tsunami recovery program in Meulaboh, he was also involved as an expert consultant for application development at the Medan City Revenue Service from 2011-2014, and he served as Head IT Consultant for PT. Dhiarga in Medan. In 2019, Mr Romi was also involved in an orangutan monitoring project funded by USAID in Banda Aceh. Mr. Romi Fadillah Rahmat started his research while studying for his master degree in Malaysia, with the focus of his research at that time on Brain-like Computing using the Distributed Adaptive Neuro-Gen Learning Engine, which is one of the novel methods he invented. Then Mr. Romi also received 17 research grants from 2014 until now, both from the Ministry of Education and Culture funds and from the Talenta USU research fund. His research interests are brain-like computing, image processing, image vision, deep learning, virtual reality, real-time processing, and data analytics. He has published more than 100 publications with 10 international journal articles. He won 2nd place as the Best Researcher in 2018 from USU.

More Mohammad Andri Budiman Vice Dean 1 Fakultas Ilmu Komputer dan Teknologi Informasi

Dr. Mohammad Andri Budiman was born in Medan on October 8, 1975. He holds a bachelor's degree in Engineering from ITB, a Master of Computer Science degree from University of New South Wales, Sydney, Australia and a Master of Engineering Management from University of Technology, Sydney, Australia. In 2021 he earned his doctoral degree from the Doctoral Program in Computer Science at . From 2009–2017, Dr. Mohammad Andri Budiman was secretary of Master’s Program in Informatics Fasilkom-TI USU. During that time, he also appointed as Chair of the USU ICT Task Force (2012-2013), member of the USU senate (2013-2014), member of Team Formulator of USU's Strategic Plan and RPJM (2014), and Chair of Fasilkom-TI Advisory Council for the 2013-2017 period. From 2017 to 2021, he appointed as head of Fasilkom-TI Algorithm and Programming Laboratory, and currently Dr. Mohammad Andri Budiman is Vice Dean I for Academic, Student Affairs and Alumni, Fasilkom-TI. Dr. Mohammad Andri Budiman is certified as a Java Programmer from Sun Microsystems, United States of America. He loved by his students, therefore for 2 consecutive years (2013-2014) he won the position of Favorite Lecturer in S-1 Computer Science Study Program. At the 2015 USU Anniversary, he was the second best presenter in the Lecturer Category. Not only that, his ability as a lecturer was also recognized by getting the Best Lecturer at the 2019 Fasilkom-TI Awards. Mr. Mohammad Andri Budiman also has a high IQ, so he can join the Member of IHIQS (The International High IQ Society) in 2016 and Member of Mensa International High IQ Society in 2017. The best human being is the most beneficial to others. Love those on earth, surely those in the sky will love you. Let's dhikr as much as possible, do our best, worship as solemnly as possible. Achieve His forgiveness, reward, love, pleasure, and paradise. The world is temporary, the hereafter is forever.

More Sarah Purnamawati Vice Dean 2 Fakultas Ilmu Komputer dan Teknologi Informasi

Mrs. Sarah Purnamawati is a distinguished lecturer in the Undergraduate Program in Information Technology at , where she specializes in Database Systems, Artificial Intelligence, and Information System Management. With her extensive knowledge and experience, she is dedicated to equipping her students with the skills necessary to navigate the rapidly changing technology landscape. Mrs. Sarah emphasizes hands-on learning, encouraging students to apply theoretical concepts to real-world scenarios, thereby enhancing their problem-solving abilities. In addition to her teaching responsibilities, Mrs. Purnamawati serves as the Vice Dean for Administration, Finance, Human Resources, and Assets, where she plays a critical role in the operational management of the faculty. Her leadership ensures that the administrative aspects of the program run smoothly, allowing both students and faculty to focus on academic excellence. Committed to fostering an inclusive and supportive educational environment, she actively engages with students to understand their needs and aspirations, helping them achieve their academic goals.

In carrying out its duties, the Head of the Faculty is assisted by Managers and Heads of Units as Elements Helper of Leadership

About Us Education Research Community Service News E-Magazine Faculty News Faculty Agenda Faculty Announcement Faculty Article PPID Executive Organizational Structure Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology USU

The leadership at the Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology, USU, is structured to efficiently manage the diverse aspects of academic life and institutional development. The Dean serves as the overall academic leader, steering strategic planning, decision-making, and budgetary matters. The Vice Dean for Academic Affairs oversees curriculum development and student academic affairs, ensuring high academic standards. The Vice Dean for Research and Development focuses on advancing research initiatives, securing funding, and fostering an environment conducive to innovation.

Within departments, Chairpersons manage academic programs, faculty development, and research initiatives. Faculty members contribute to teaching, research, and service, aligning their efforts with the overall strategic vision. Administrative staff play a crucial role in facilitating departmental operations, managing budgets, and providing logistical support.

Academic program responsibilities include designing and updating curricula, ensuring program accreditation, and fostering a dynamic learning environment. Program coordinators work closely with faculty to address student needs. Research centers and labs, under the leadership of directors, set research priorities, secure funding, and facilitate collaboration.

Student Affairs professionals provide support services such as academic advising, career counseling, and extracurricular activities, aiming for a holistic student experience. Those overseeing collaborations and industry partnerships work to establish and maintain relationships with institutions and industry partners, fostering opportunities for students.

Support units, including IT support, administrative services, and library services, contribute to the smooth functioning of the Faculty. Collectively, this organizational structure ensures a well-rounded approach to the Faculty's mission, incorporating academic excellence, research advancement, student development, and strong external collaborations. Each role within the structure plays a vital part in the success and impact of the Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology at .

The study program at the Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology, (USU), is a multifaceted educational framework meticulously designed to empower students with a profound understanding of computer science and information technology. At the helm of each academic program, dedicated coordinators play a pivotal role in shaping curricula that not only meet academic standards but also remain responsive to the evolving needs of the tech industry. These programs span across various academic levels, including Bachelor's, Master's, and Doctoral degrees, offering students a progression of knowledge and skills.

Comprising a cadre of seasoned educators and industry professionals, the faculty members within the study program are committed to delivering a well-rounded education. Their expertise spans theoretical foundations and practical applications, creating an immersive learning environment. This holistic approach ensures that graduates emerge not only with technical proficiency but also with critical thinking skills essential for success in the dynamic landscape of computer science and information technology.

The study program places a strong emphasis on research and innovation. Collaborative efforts within specialized research centers and labs provide students with opportunities to engage in cutting-edge projects, contributing to advancements in the field. This exposure not only enriches their academic experience but also equips them with the skills needed to tackle real-world challenges.

Furthermore, the program is attuned to the industry's demands, fostering partnerships and collaborations to bridge the gap between academia and the professional world. Internships, industry projects, and guest lectures from practitioners are integrated into the curriculum, offering students a practical understanding of the industry they are poised to enter.

In essence, the study program at the Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology, USU, stands as a testament to a commitment to excellence in education. By combining academic rigor, practical experience, and research opportunities, the program cultivates a generation of tech professionals who are not only adept in current technologies but are also well-prepared for the innovations of the future.

About Us Education Research Community Service News E-Magazine Faculty News Faculty Agenda Faculty Announcement Faculty Article PPID Executive Accreditation & Achievements Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology Superior Quality, Qualified HR The Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology of places the improvement of the quality of human resources as a top priority. In an effort to realize this commitment, FASILKOM-TI has successfully achieved accreditation, which is a recognition of the quality standards of education and services. This accreditation not only reflects the faculty's commitment to the provision of quality education but also demonstrates a focus on developing students' competencies and skills.

About Us Education Research Community Service News E-Magazine Faculty News Faculty Agenda Faculty Announcement Faculty Article PPID Executive The 6ᵀᴴ International Conference on Computing and Applied Informatics 2022

Tuesday, 8th November, 2022 8:00 AM

Tuesday, 8th November, 2022 6:00 PM

Fasilkom-TI International Conference with the theme A New World of Research: Sustainable Research in a Digital World

Event Notification: The Conference's Book of Abstracts is available through this link

Theme: "A New World of Research: Sustainable Research in a Digital World"

The recent event of pandemic has transformed our life significantly. We are required to embrace new normals and new standards in our way of living. To perform this transformation, research played a significant role to introduce new innovations in order to speed up the process. However, planning and performing a sustainable research in this changing environment were also a challenge. Researchers were required to adapt their way to perform collaboration and communication. During this transformaiton, we have introduced several innovation such as concept, methods, and tools, to maintain a sustainable research.

The Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology, , is inviting all researchers to present their work in The 6th International Confrence on Computing and Applied Informatics 2022. Our objective is to provide an environment where participating researchers are able to communicate, disscuiss, and collaborate in this event. In this conference, researchers are invited to share their research and innovation while experiences and challenges in maintaining a sustainable research in a changing environment.

About Us Education Research Community Service News E-Magazine Faculty News Faculty Agenda Faculty Announcement Faculty Article PPID Executive Alumni and Careers Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology A Wise Alumni Never Misses the Tracer Study Tracer Study will provide information about the results of career and life tracking of alumni after they graduate from the university. This is very useful for prospective students to know how successful alumni have been in their careers and how their university experience can help in achieving those goals. In addition, the Tracer Study also assists universities in improving the quality of education and improve programs that have been provided so that they can better prepare students to enter the world workforce. With the Tracer Study, the university can obtain valuable feedback from its alumni which can be used as evaluation and improvement material for the programs provided.

Direktori USU Portal Akademik E-Learning USU Repositori USU

The University of North Sumatra provides a variety of information systems that are useful for alumni in make it easier to carry out activities and obtain alumni information.

About Us Education Research Community Service News E-Magazine Faculty News Faculty Agenda Faculty Announcement Faculty Article PPID Executive Building the Foundation for a Digital Future Doctoral Program in Computer Science General Information About Academic Research & Service Alumni Activities SDGs

The Doctoral Program in Computer Science of (USU) is the highest level of computer science education at USU. This program serves as an advanced education for graduates of the postgraduate program to deepen their scientific research skills independently to make significant contributions in the field of information technology.

Supported by professional and internationally reputable industry experts, we are committed to guiding students to become computer and information technology experts and professionals in developing concepts of science, technology, and research at the national or international level. Graduates of this program are expected to be able to carry out their responsibilities and profession as qualified, knowledgeable, and experienced IT experts so that they can contribute to advancing technological development in Indonesia. They have career opportunities at the highest level in various IT fields, including as computer science researchers, artificial intelligence designers and consultants, data scientists, system managers, and information technology professionals.

To become a leading study program in the field of Computer Science research to bridge the world of education with industry in a global order in 2020.

Mission remove To organize areas of expertise and research in Computer Science in the field of computing, including soft computing, information retrieval, intelligent systems, mathematical modeling, and advanced networking.

To organize a research-based Doctoral Study Program in the field of Computer Science.

To develop innovative science and technology that can contribute to a better quality of life in society in the frame of Tropical Science and Medicine, Agroindustry, Local Wisdom, Energy [sustainable], Natural Resources [biodiversity, forest, marine, mine, tourism], Technology [appropriate] and Arts [ethnic] (TALENTA) USU.

To organize and develop methodologies for the development of Computer Science and Information and Communication Technology (ICT) so they are able to become problem solvers within the scope of their expertise.

To organize research and community service activities related to scientific principles in thinking, behaving, and acting as scientists in the field of Computer Science who can contribute to a better quality of life in society while upholding ethics and morals.

Goals remove To produce graduates with insights in the computing field, including soft computing, information retrieval, intelligent system, mathematical modeling, and advanced networking.

To produce graduates who are open and responsive to the development and advancement of Computer Science.

To produce graduates who have the core values of BINTANG (Devoted to Almighty God in the frame of diversity, Innovative and has Integrity, Resilient and Wise) who can solve problems in the field of Computer Science.

To produce graduates who master the methodology of developing Computer Science and information and communication technology (ICT) so they are able to become problem solvers in the scope of their expertise.

To produce graduates who master scientific principles in thinking, behaving, and acting as scientists in the field of Computer Science who can contribute to a better quality of life in society while upholding ethics and morals.

Prof. Drs. Poltak Sihombing M.Kom., Ph.D Head Of Doctoral Program In Computer Science Prof. Dr. Syahril Efendi S.Si., M.IT.

Prof. Drs. Mahyuddin M.IT., Ph.D.

Prof. Dr. Drs. Opim Salim Sitompul M.Sc Dr. Maya Silvi Lydia B.Sc., M.Sc.

FACULTY OF COMPUTER SCIENCE AND INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY UNIVERSITAS SUMATERA UTARA

Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology

9 Universitas Road, Medan, North Sumatra, Indonesia 20155

mail fasilkomti@usu.ac.id (General enquiries or feedback) Sitemap Report Frequently Asked Questions Archive Website Usage Policy Website Copyright

The Study Programs research roadmap includes analysis of recent trends, identification of research gaps, and new research opportunities. The next step is to develop research collaborations, improve infrastructure, funding, and researcher capacity. The goal is to ensure the relevance and contribution of the Study Program in solving complex problems in its field of study.

About Us Education Research Community Service News E-Magazine Faculty News Faculty Agenda Faculty Announcement Faculty Article PPID Executive Building the Foundation for a Digital Future Doctoral Program in Computer Science General Information About Academic Research & Service Alumni Activities SDGs

The Doctoral Program in Computer Science of (USU) is the highest level of computer science education at USU. This program serves as an advanced education for graduates of the postgraduate program to deepen their scientific research skills independently to make significant contributions in the field of information technology.

Year Established 2014 Lecturer 5 Professor 4 139 Students 48 Staff 1 Alumni 33 Citation With great pleasure, I am pleased to welcome you to the Doctoral Program in Computer Science at the Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology, .

In our pursuit of academic excellence and alignment with global education standards, the Doctoral Program in Computer Science at (USU) actively participates in the university’s Internationalization Program. We are committed to fostering a research-driven environment that not only enhances theoretical understanding but also equips our graduates with the practical skills necessary to contribute effectively to the field. Our curriculum is continuously refined based on feedback from various stakeholders, including industry experts, alumni, and academic partners. This ensures that our program remains relevant and responsive to the dynamic landscape of technology and research. The Doctoral Program in Computer Science is dedicated to maintaining the highest standards of education that meet international benchmarks. We prioritize the development of our students’ research capabilities by encouraging collaboration with industry and academic institutions. Our partnerships provide valuable opportunities for real-world application of research and foster innovation. Additionally, we focus on enhancing the quality of our faculty by incorporating industry practitioners into our teaching and mentorship processes. Moreover, we promote a culture of integrity, transparency, and accountability in all administrative processes. Our program encourages active participation from students and stakeholders, facilitating a collaborative learning environment. We welcome input, suggestions, and concerns through various channels, including our online platform at wbs.usu.ac.id, reflecting our commitment to continuous improvement and effective communication. May God bless our efforts in advancing quality education and contributing to society. Ameen.

Prof. Drs. Poltak Sihombing, M.Kom., Ph.D Head of Doctoral Program in Computer Science Doctoral Program in Computer Science Accredited Very Good No. 096/SK/LAM-INFOKOM/Ak/D/XII/2022 Curriculum Doctoral Program in Computer Science

The Doctoral Program in Computer Science of (USU) is the highest level of computer science education at USU. This program serves as an advanced education for graduates of the postgraduate program to deepen their scientific research skills independently to make significant contributions in the field of information technology.

Supported by professional and internationally reputable industry experts, we are committed to guiding students to become computer and information technology experts and professionals in developing concepts of science, technology, and research at the national or international level. Graduates of this program are expected to be able to carry out their responsibilities and profession as qualified, knowledgeable, and experienced IT experts so that they can contribute to advancing technological development in Indonesia. They have career opportunities at the highest level in various IT fields, including as computer science researchers, artificial intelligence designers and consultants, data scientists, system managers, and information technology professionals.

To become a leading study program in the field of Computer Science research to bridge the world of education with industry in a global order in 2020.

Mission remove To organize areas of expertise and research in Computer Science in the field of computing, including soft computing, information retrieval, intelligent systems, mathematical modeling, and advanced networking.

To organize a research-based Doctoral Study Program in the field of Computer Science.

To develop innovative science and technology that can contribute to a better quality of life in society in the frame of Tropical Science and Medicine, Agroindustry, Local Wisdom, Energy [sustainable], Natural Resources [biodiversity, forest, marine, mine, tourism], Technology [appropriate] and Arts [ethnic] (TALENTA) USU.

To organize and develop methodologies for the development of Computer Science and Information and Communication Technology (ICT) so they are able to become problem solvers within the scope of their expertise.

To organize research and community service activities related to scientific principles in thinking, behaving, and acting as scientists in the field of Computer Science who can contribute to a better quality of life in society while upholding ethics and morals.

Goals remove To produce graduates with insights in the computing field, including soft computing, information retrieval, intelligent system, mathematical modeling, and advanced networking.

To produce graduates who are open and responsive to the development and advancement of Computer Science.

To produce graduates who have the core values of BINTANG (Devoted to Almighty God in the frame of diversity, Innovative and has Integrity, Resilient and Wise) who can solve problems in the field of Computer Science.

To produce graduates who master the methodology of developing Computer Science and information and communication technology (ICT) so they are able to become problem solvers in the scope of their expertise.

To produce graduates who master scientific principles in thinking, behaving, and acting as scientists in the field of Computer Science who can contribute to a better quality of life in society while upholding ethics and morals.

Here are the study fees Doctoral Program in Computer Science Doctoral Program Institutional Development Fee S(Independent Program Only) IDR 11,500,000 IDR 25,000,000 One-Time Payment Doctoral Program Education Development Contribution IDR 15,000,000 Per student for 1 semester

Doctoral students in Computer Science receive computer science education so that they are able to create updates from the most recent developments in the field of computer science, compile scientific papers and publish them in internationally reputable journals, solve complex problems in the field of computer science through inter, multi, and transdisciplinary approaches, are able to follow and respond to developments in the field of computer science, and are able to lead in the field of computer science and informatics

Learning Outcomes 1 Respect God Almighty, uphold religious values, morals, and professional ethics, abide by the law, have a sense of patriotism and the duty to contribute to the nation and state, and respect the law.

2 Sincere, independent, professionally competent, and socially aware

3 Having a personality of leadership and being able to conduct ‘ socially transdisciplinary research in the field of computer science.

4 Capable of constructing scientific arguments using scientific concepts and generating ideas, methods, and tools in the field of computer science to assist new discoveries in computer science and technology, particularly for artificial intelligence, the Internet of things, computer networks and data communication, and machine learning development.

5 Capable of developing a computer science research roadmap based on the most recent technology and scientific advancements

6 Capable of imparting knowledge in the field of computer science for the community's benefit.

7 Capable of providing problem-solving services by employing inter-, multi-, or transdisciplinary

FACULTY OF COMPUTER SCIENCE AND INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY UNIVERSITAS SUMATERA UTARA

The Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) are a set of goals set by the United Nations (UN) to end poverty, protect the environment, and ensure sustainable social, economic, and environmental well-being in the environment, and ensure sustainable social, economic, and environmental well-being worldwide. around the world. These goals were adopted in 2015 through the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development. Development. General Information About Academic Research & Service Alumni Activities SDGs

As an advanced study program after the Undergraduate Programs in Computer Science & Information Technology, the Master's Program in Data Science and Artificial Intelligence of (USU) focuses on developing its students' capabilities in two specific areas, namely data science and artificial intelligence. Data science is a discipline that combines knowledge in a field with skills in programming, mathematics, and statistics, aiming to extract information or knowledge from data. Meanwhile, artificial intelligence focuses on solving problems related to human cognitive functions, such as machine learning, problem solving, and pattern recognition, which are then applied in technology.

Year Established xxx Lecturer 5 Professor xxx 104 Students 43 Staff 1 Alumni 6 Citation With great pleasure, I am pleased to welcome you to the Master's Program in Data Science and Artificial Intelligence at the Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology, .

In the realm of the Master’s Degree Program in Data Science and Artificial Intelligence at the , a distinguished academic institution deeply dedicated to fostering inventive thinking and technology-driven solutions for a more intelligent and interconnected future, you are warmly welcomed. During this era of continual digital advancement, the significance of data science and artificial intelligence has been steadily increasing. Our program has been meticulously crafted to furnish students with the essential knowledge and expertise required to spearhead innovation and adaptation in alignment with the contemporary challenges. The meticulously structured curriculum encompasses comprehensive theoretical modules along with hands-on practical applications, empowering students to effectively address the authentic obstacles encountered in today’s global landscape. Within this educational framework, students are encouraged to delve into the intricacies of data, algorithmic advancements, machine learning, and the practical deployment of artificial intelligence across diverse business and technological scenarios. Our faculty consists of a cadre of distinguished educators who are authorities in their respective domains, actively engaged not only in academic instruction but also in cutting-edge research endeavours and interdisciplinary collaborations. Recognizing that innovation thrives in a collaborative environment, we foster interdisciplinary cooperation and have forged partnerships with a multitude of institutions and industries to ensure that our educational offerings remain pertinent and actionable in real-world settings. Our students are given the opportunity to undertake challenging projects, partake in research initiatives alongside faculty members and partake in global engagement through student exchange programs and academic conferences. We take immense pride in our multifaceted community, which brings forth fresh viewpoints and concepts to our campus, thereby enhancing the educational journey for all involved. Within the Master’s Degree Program in Data Science and Artificial Intelligence, we are cultivating not only proficient data analysts and artificial intelligence specialists but also ethical and perceptive future leaders. We eagerly anticipate your involvement in this expedition to delve into uncharted realms of knowledge, collaboratively forging a path towards an inventive and sustainable future. With gratitude and felicitations on becoming a cherished member of the ’s extended family.

Dr. Erna Budhiarti Nababan, M.IT Head of Master's Program in Data Science and Artificial Intelligence

General Information About Academic Research & Service Alumni Activities SDGs

As an advanced study program after the Undergraduate Programs in Computer Science & Information Technology, the Master's Program in Data Science and Artificial Intelligence of (USU) focuses on developing its students' capabilities in two specific areas, namely data science and artificial intelligence. Data science is a discipline that combines knowledge in a field with skills in programming, mathematics, and statistics, aiming to extract information or knowledge from data. Meanwhile, artificial intelligence focuses on solving problems related to human cognitive functions, such as machine learning, problem solving, and pattern recognition, which are then applied in technology.

Supported by experts with international expertise and backed by an integrated curriculum, we have a deep commitment to prepare our students to take on the role of technopreneurs and IT experts who excel in their fields and can compete in the national and international markets. Graduates of our program have great opportunities for careers as data scientists and artificial intelligence developers.

To become a leading master’s study program in the field of data science and artificial intelligence that produces competent graduates with global competitiveness and is recognized at the international level by 2024.

Mission remove To develop new specialized curricula and an innovative M.Sc. program on Data Science and Artificial Intelligence, thus helping build the capacity of the Asian partner countries’ (PC) HEIs, improve the level of competencies and skills offered, and address the existing absence of a similar programme.

To promote cooperation, exchange of know-how and good practices in Αsia between EU and PC HEIs.

Establish viable synergies and links with the regional IT Industry in order to address their needs in specialised personnel in DS&AI, training needs and enhance the employability of DS&AI graduates.

Goals remove Our program has been meticulously crafted to furnish students with the essential knowledge and expertise required to spearhead innovation and adaptation in alignment with the contemporary challenges.

Within this educational framework, students are encouraged to delve into the intricacies of data, algorithmic advancements, machine learning, and the practical deployment of artificial intelligence across diverse business and technological scenarios.

Recognizing that innovation thrives in a collaborative environment, we foster interdisciplinary cooperation and have forged partnerships with a multitude of institutions and industries to ensure that our educational offerings remain pertinent and actionable in real-world settings.

Graduates are capable of large-scale data processing, building and managing big data infrastructure, and getting insight through a multidisciplinary approach.

Learning Outcomes 1 Master theoretical or applied concepts in the field of Data Science and Artificial Intelligence.

2 Have in-depth knowledge of Data Science and Artificial Intelligence-based application development.

3 Have the ability to process large amounts of data and gain insights by using a multi-disciplinary approach.

4 Have the ability to develop a solution or innovation in the field of Data Science and Artificial Intelligence that is beneficial to society and contributes to scientific development.

5 Have the ability to develop an innovative solution using intelligent system-based applications, especially those using machine learning concepts.

6 Have knowledge of Data Science and Artificial Intelligence applications in industry, society, and government.

7 Have knowledge of the latest (state-of-the-art) developments of concepts, methods, and technologies in the field of Data Science and Artificial Intelligence.

8 Have the ability to carry out the learning process and implement the latest concepts/methods/technologies in the field of Data Science and Artificial Intelligence.

9 Able to conduct academic validation or studies according to their field of expertise in solving problems in society or relevant industries through the development of their knowledge and expertise.

10 Able to make decisions in the context of solving problems in the development of science and technology that pay attention to and apply humanities values based on analytical or experimental studies of information and data.

11 Students can explain the basics of linguistic computing and natural language processing (NLP).

12 Students can apply state-of-the-art pre-processing and parsing methods for natural languages.

13 Students can describe and use appropriate learning techniques and models for NLP problem scenarios.

14 Students can design and implement NLP applications.

As an advanced study program after the Undergraduate Programs in Computer Science & Information Technology, the Master's Program in Informatics Engineering of (USU) has a primary focus on equipping students with in-depth insights, technical expertise, and world-class competencies to compete in the global market.

Year Established 2009 Lecturer 5 Professor xxx 33 Students 52 Staff 1 Alumni 560 Citation With great pleasure, I am pleased to welcome you to the Master's Program in Informatics Engineering at the Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology, .

Assalamu'alaikum Wr. Wb. The Master’s Program in Informatics Engineering is strongly committed to improving the quality of education, broadening students' horizons and skills, and supporting the internationalization agenda launched by the university. As part of this commitment, the Master's Program in Informatics Engineering has designed an Outcome-Based Education (OBE) curriculum to ensure that each graduate has a strong theoretical understanding and practical skills relevant to industry needs. The curriculum development process is based on input from various parties, such as industry, alumni, and associations, to ensure sustainability and relevance to the increasingly complex world of work. The Master’s Program in Informatics Engineering pays attention to developing students' practical skills and knowledge through various workshops and seminars to deepen their knowledge and skills. Collaboration has also been developed with several reputable universities abroad to align student and lecturer research quality with the latest conditions. Our commitment to quality academic services, integrity, and open communication are prioritized in organizing higher education in Indonesia. Hopefully, all these efforts will contribute significantly to developing higher education in Indonesia. Wassalamu'alaikum Wr. Wb.

Dr. Eng Ade Candra, S.T., M.Kom.

About Us Education Research Community Service News E-Magazine Faculty News Faculty Agenda Faculty Announcement Faculty Article PPID Executive Building the Foundation for a Digital Future Master&#039;s Program in Informatics Engineering General Information About Academic Research & Service Alumni Activities SDGs

As an advanced study program after the Undergraduate Programs in Computer Science & Information Technology, the Master's Program in Informatics Engineering of (USU) has a primary focus on equipping students with in-depth insights, technical expertise, and world-class competencies to compete in the global market.

Supported by lecturers who are experts in the field of informatics engineering with national teaching certificates and supported by an integrated curriculum, we have a deep commitment to providing intensive and effective guidance and learning experiences to our students. Our goal is to enhance students' abilities and prepare them to take on the role of technopreneurs and IT experts who are competent in their fields, as well as excellent and able to compete in the national and international markets. Graduates of the Master's Program in Informatics Engineering are expected to pursue professions in various technology fields, including technopreneurship, IT consultants, data scientists, etc.

The Master’s Program in Informatics Engineering aims to educate students to become experts in the field of computer science or informatics engineering who are able to develop science and its applications, conduct research, design and implement software, and be able to solve computational problems in various fields. Since its establishment to date (2009 to 2013), the Master’s Program in Informatics Engineering has produced 85 alumni and the graduates are given the M.Kom. (Master of Computer) degree. Now, the study program is also under the auspices of the Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology.

The Master’s Program in Informatics Engineering aims to educate students to become experts in the field of computer science or informatics engineering who are able to develop science and its applications, conduct research, design and implement software, and be able to solve computational problems in various fields. Since its establishment (2009) to 2013, the Master’s Program in Informatics Engineering has produced 85 alumni, and the graduates are given the M.Kom. (Master of Computer) degree. Now, the study program is also under the auspices of the Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology.

To become a Study Program that excels in Education, Research, and Social Contribution nationally and internationally in the field of informatics engineering, especially in the fields of Cyber Security, Machine Learning, and the Internet of Things.

Mission remove To organize and develop national and international quality education and research in the field of Informatics Engineering, especially Cyber Security, Machine Learning, and the Internet of Things.

To develop and disseminate innovative science and technology that can make social contributions in the frame of Tropical Science and Medicine, Agroindustry, Local Wisdom, Energy [sustainable], Natural Resources [biodiversity, forest marine, mine, tourism], Technology [appropriate] and Arts [ethnic] (TALENTA) USU.

To utilize science and technology for the welfare and progress of the nation through the organization of research and community service activities while upholding ethical and moral values.

Goals remove To educate and produce graduates who have the core values of BINTANG (Devoted to Almighty God in the frame of diversity, Innovative and Has Integrity, Resilient and Wise) who can solve problems through science and technology of informatics engineering.

To educate and produce graduates who have high insight through excellent research in the fields of Cyber Security, Machine Learning, and the Internet of Things.

To educate and produce graduates who are able to develop and apply science and technology to produce research that is innovative, adaptive, noble, and disseminated through scientific works with national and international reputations.

To educate and produce graduates who are able to think critically and innovatively in their work while upholding the professional code of ethics.

Dr. Eng Ade Candra S.T., M.Kom.

TIA5105 Internet of Things Communication and Networking 3 SKS

Semester 2 add TIA5201 Software Engineering 3 SKS

TIA5204P Network System Security 3 SKS

Semester 3 add TIA5301P Computational Linguistics 3 SKS

TIA5302P Blockchain Technology 3 SKS

Semester 4 add TIA5401 Result Seminar 2 SKS

Here are the study fees Master's Program in Informatics Engineering

Master's Program Institutional Development Fee S(Independent Program Only) IDR 7,000,000 IDR 15,000,000 One-Time Payment Master's Program Education Development Contribution IDR 8,000,000 Per student for 1 semester

The Masters Program in Informatics Engineering is a nationally and internationally recognized study program that excels in education, research, and social contribution in the field of informatics engineering, particularly in the fields of cyber security, machine learning, and the Internet of Things. This is accomplished through the advancement of science and technology in the production of innovative work to solve scientific, technological, and practical problems in society through measurable and scientifically tested research management and development, with the goal of gaining national and international recognition.

Learning Outcomes 1 Integrate original new ideas (improvements/innovations) for the advancement of informatics engineering/computer science through ethical, logical, critical, systematic, creative, and innovative thoughts, concepts, and scientific studies that can be published in reputable national or international journals.

2 Develop informatics engineering / computer science knowledge using a cross-disciplinary or multidisciplinary strategy to solving relevant and complicated social or industrial problems.

3 In research planning or project implementation, evaluate critically and professionally.

The Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) are a set of goals set by the United Nations (UN) to end poverty, protect the environment, and ensure sustainable social, economic, and environmental well-being in the environment, and ensure sustainable social, economic, and environmental well-being worldwide. around the world. These goals were adopted in 2015 through the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development. Development. In an effort to achieve the Sustainable Development Goals, Master's Program in Informatics Engineering contributes to creating ideas that are in line with the 2030 Agenda.

General Information About Academic Research & Service Alumni Activities SDGs

As a study program that has been accredited Excellent and established since 2001, the Undergraduate Program in Computer Science of (USU) has produced numerous outstanding students and created qualified computer experts spread throughout Indonesia. The program aims to teach the science of computing, hardware management, and computer software development.

Year Established 2001 Lecturer 13 Professor xxx 268 Students 561 Staff 2 Alumni 1523 Citation 143 With great pleasure, I am pleased to welcome you to the Undergraduate Program in Computer Science at the Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology, .

Assalamualaikum Wr. Wb. In the spirit of continuous improvement and dedication to achieving global education standards, the Undergraduate Program in Computer Science at the (USU) participates in supporting the Internationalization Program launched by the university. As part of this effort, the Undergraduate Program in Computer Science has implemented an Outcome-Based Education (OBE) curriculum to ensure that each graduate not only masters the theory, but also has practical skills that are ready for use in the world of work. This curriculum adjustment is carried out by taking into account input from various parties, including industry, alumni, and stakeholders, to ensure its relevance and applicability in the field. The Undergraduate Program in Computer Science is committed to continuously developing and updating the education system, especially the curriculum, so that it is not only relevant to the needs of the times, but also meets international standards. This is proof of the dedication of the Computer Science Study Program in improving the quality of education and meeting the Key Performance Indicators (KPI) that have been set. The Undergraduate Program in Computer Science also focuses on developing students' practical skills through increasing the depth and breadth of laboratory-based knowledge, as well as collaboration with various institutions for internship programs that prepare students with real work experience. In addition, improving the quality of lecturers and teaching staff is a priority for the Undergraduate Program in Computer Science, by involving industry practitioners in the teaching and learning process. The Undergraduate Program in Computer Science is also committed to improving the quality of research involving collaboration with industry partners and active student participation. The Undergraduate Program in Computer Science always encourages collaborative and participatory teaching methods, and applies the principles of transparency, service orientation, and support for corruption-free integrity zones in all our administrative and administrative processes. Undergraduate Program in Computer Science is open to any input, complaints, and complaints through various channels that have been provided, including the online platform at wbs.usu.ac.id, as part of our efforts to continuously improve and provide effective solutions for all parties. May Allah SWT bless our efforts in providing quality education and benefitting the people. Amen. Wassalamu'alaikum Wr. Wb.

Undergraduate Program In Computer Science

Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology

my_location phone (061) 8211633 mail ilkom@usu.ac.id fasilkomti_usu Fasilkom - TI USU

Paving the way for my successful IT company and national-level opportunities.

As a young person from a rural and remote area, my initial step in facing the IT industry began by seizing the opportunities offered by Fasilkom-TI USU. Through my higher education there, I became the first Computer Science graduate in the history of my family and hometown. This achievement brought a special pride to us.

Higher education also helped me establish and sustain my IT company to this day. The coursework provided a strong foundation for my skills.

During my studies, learning algorithms, programming, and project management in informatics were my main focuses. I was active in campus communities and organizations that helped strengthen my mental resilience, time management, public speaking, and decision-making skills. These activities have opened doors of opportunity for me up to a national level in the IT industry.

About Us Education Research Community Service News E-Magazine Faculty News Faculty Agenda Faculty Announcement Faculty Article PPID Executive Building the Foundation for a Digital Future Undergraduate Program in Computer Science General Information About Academic Research & Service Alumni Activities SDGs

As a study program that has been accredited Excellent and established since 2001, the Undergraduate Program in Computer Science of (USU) has produced numerous outstanding students and created qualified computer experts spread throughout Indonesia. The program aims to teach the science of computing, hardware management, and computer software development.

Taught by experts in the field of information technology with national teaching certificates and supported by an integrated curriculum, we have a deep commitment in providing our students with an interactive education and learning experiences in the hope that they will become the best in the field of information technology, competence, and able to compete in the era of digitalization, both on a national and international scale. Graduates of our program have extensive career opportunities in various digital fields, such as software engineers, web designers, information technology consultants, and many more.

The Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology (Fasilkom-TI) of was established on September 6, 2011, with the issuance of the Decree of the Rector of USU Number 2360/UN5.1.R/SK/PRS/2011. The establishment of Fasilkom-TI USU has a long history and involves many parties. If calculated from the issuance of the permit to open a Computer Science Study Program by the Directorate General of Higher Education of the Ministry of Education and Culture of the Republic of Indonesia on November 22, 2001, until the formation of the Faculty, the time required is ten years. The first study program formed was the Undergraduate (S-1) Program in Computer Science under FMIPA USU’s auspices. The Undergraduate (S-1) Program in Computer Science was established in accordance with the Decree of the Directorate General of Higher Education Number 3551/D/T/2001 dated November 22, 2001, on permission to organize the Undergraduate (S-1) Program in Computer Science.

At the end of 2007, the Directorate General of Higher Education issued a Decree on the Structuring and Codification of Study Programs in Higher Education Institutions Number 163/KEP/DIKTI/2007 dated 27 November 2007, which, among others, regulates the naming of undergraduate (S-1) computer study programs as follows: S-1 Informatics Engineering, S-1 Computer Systems, and S-1 Information Systems. However, this naming was later refined with the issuance of the Circular Letter of the Directorate General of Higher Education Number 1030/D/T/2010. With the issuance of the Circular Letter of the Directorate General of Higher Education, higher education institutions organizing the field of computers and informatics were given the opportunity to reorganize the naming of the study programs they manage. thus re-established the name for its two study programs to become the Undergraduate (S-1) Program in Computer Science and the Undergraduate (S-1) Program in Information Technology.

arrow_back_ios_new arrow_forward_ios

To become a research-based Computer Science Study Program that is adaptive, collaborative, and creative with international standards, especially in the fields of artificial intelligence, infrastructure and security, and software engineering.

Mission remove To prepare Computer Science academicians who have the character of BINTANG (Devoted to Almighty God in the frame of diversity, Innovative and has Integrity, Resilient and Wise) and are ready to compete in the global community.

To improve Education in the field of Computer Science, especially in the areas of expertise of artificial intelligence, infrastructure and security, and software engineering.

To develop Research in the field of Computer Science and innovative technology that can contribute to Society’s quality of life in the frame of Tropical Science and Medicine, Agroindustry, Local Wisdom, Energy [sustainable], Natural Resources [biodiversity, forest marine, mine, tourism], Technology [appropriate] and Arts [ethnic] (TALENTA) USU.

To organize Community Service by utilizing information and computer technology to improve Society’s quality of life.

To establish Cooperation with graduate users on an ongoing basis in the fields of research, community service, and field work practice to improve the quality of education.

To play an active role in higher education professional organizations in the field of computer science to answer stakeholder needs.

Goals remove To produce graduates who are able to solve real problems in the field of computer science.

To produce graduates who have the core values of BINTANG (Devoted to Almighty God in the frame of diversity, Innovative and has Integrity, Resilient and Wise).

To become a study program with good governance in order to support the formation of an independent USU.

Here are the study fees Undergraduate Program in Computer Science

Undergraduate Program SNBP & SNBT Pathway UKT Group I IDR 500,000 UKT Group II IDR 1,000,000 UKT Group III IDR 2,400,000 UKT Group IV IDR 3,100,000 UKT Group V IDR 4,700,000 UKT Group VI IDR 5,400,000 UKT Group VII IDR 7,700,000 UKT Group VIII IDR 10,000,000 Undergraduate Program Institutional Development Fee S(Independent Program Only) IDR 15,000,000 One-Time Payment

Graduates of the Undergraduate Program in Computer Science are capable of compiling scientific descriptions, having the competence to develop problem-solving models for both individual and organizational objectives by implementing computer science algorithms, designing and implementing computation-based solutions that follow the most recent development approaches, and evaluating the efficiency and effectiveness of the methods in solving problems from various points of view.

Learning Outcomes 1 Capable of identifying, analyzing, and applying his skills to solve challenges in the field of computer science

2 Mastering theoretical concepts in computer science as well as theoretical concepts in special disciplines such as information retrieval systems, computer networks, robotics, and artificial intelligence.

3 Capable of making effective decisions based on information and data analysis in the field of computer science and also providing guidance in choosing numerous alternative solutions both independently and in groups.

4 Capable of taking responsibility for their own work and being assigned responsibility for the accomplishment of organizational goals

5 Capable of creating new job prospects by developing and applying entrepreneurial models based on computer science and information technology.

The goal is to ensure the relevance and contribution of the Study Program in solving complex problems in its field of study.

The Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) are a set of goals set by the United Nations (UN) to end poverty, protect the environment, and ensure sustainable social, economic, and environmental well-being in the environment, and ensure sustainable social, economic, and environmental well-being worldwide. around the world. These goals were adopted in 2015 through the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development. Development. In an effort to achieve the Sustainable Development Goals, Undergraduate Program in Computer Science contributes to creating ideas that are in line with the 2030 Agenda.

General Information About Academic Research & Service Alumni Activities SDGs

The Undergraduate Program in Information Technology focuses on developing knowledge in Data Science and Intelligent Systems to produce excellent, professional graduates with global competitiveness. The program provides an education that equips students with academic competencies, technical skills, and an understanding of ethics and professional responsibility in applying information technology. Graduates of the Information Technology study program have competencies in systematically applying information technology theories and practices, developing data-driven computing solutions, fostering multidisciplinary collaboration, and building technology-based entrepreneurship.

Year Established 2007 Lecturer 16 Professor xxx 225 Students 616 Staff 2 Alumni 1112 Citation 1109 With great pleasure, I am pleased to welcome you to the Undergraduate Program in Information Technology at the Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology, .

Assalamualaikum Wr. Wb. In line with our commitment to excellence and alignment with global education standards, the Undergraduate Program in Information Technology at (USU) actively participates in the university’s Internationalization Program. To enhance the educational experience, we have adopted an Outcome-Based Education (OBE) curriculum, ensuring that our graduates not only grasp theoretical concepts but also acquire practical skills that are immediately applicable in the workforce. This curriculum development process incorporates valuable input from diverse stakeholders, including industry professionals, alumni, and community partners, to maintain its relevance and effectiveness in today’s rapidly evolving technological landscape. The Undergraduate Program in Information Technology is dedicated to continually refining and updating our educational offerings to meet contemporary needs while adhering to international standards. To elevate the quality of education, we emphasize the enhancement of students' practical skills through enriched laboratory experiences and partnerships with various organizations for internship opportunities. These initiatives are designed to prepare our students with real-world experience that is crucial for their future careers. Recognizing the importance of quality instruction, we prioritize the professional development of our lecturers and teaching staff. We actively involve industry practitioners in the teaching and learning process to provide students with insights that bridge theory and practice. Moreover, our program promotes a culture of research excellence through collaboration with industry partners and encourages student involvement in innovative projects. We embrace collaborative and participatory teaching methods while upholding principles of transparency, service orientation, and integrity within all administrative processes. We welcome feedback, suggestions, and concerns through multiple channels, including our online platform at wbs.usu.ac.id. This openness is part of our commitment to continuous improvement and effective problem-solving for all stakeholders involved. May Allah SWT bless our endeavors in delivering high-quality education that benefits our community. Ameen. Wassalamu'alaikum Wr. Wb.

About Us Education Research Community Service News E-Magazine Faculty News Faculty Agenda Faculty Announcement Faculty Article PPID Executive Building the Foundation for a Digital Future Undergraduate Program in Information Technology General Information About Academic Research & Service Alumni Activities SDGs

The Undergraduate Program in Information Technology focuses on developing knowledge in Data Science and Intelligent Systems to produce excellent, professional graduates with global competitiveness. The program provides an education that equips students with academic competencies, technical skills, and an understanding of ethics and professional responsibility in applying information technology. The curriculum is designed to provide a strong foundation in information technology, data analysis, artificial intelligence, server and network security, information technology infrastructure management, and multidisciplinary aspects that support the development of data-driven computing solutions. Students are also equipped with teamwork skills, effective communication, and the ability to adapt to technological advancements. In the research field, the study program encourages the development of data-driven and artificial intelligence-based innovations relevant to industry and societal needs. Additionally, the study program actively engages in community service activities by applying research findings to enhance information literacy and technology-based solutions.

Graduates of the Information Technology study program have competencies in systematically applying information technology theories and practices, developing data-driven computing solutions, fostering multidisciplinary collaboration, and building technology-based entrepreneurship.

The proposal for the establishment of the Undergraduate Program in Information Technology was submitted in early 2007 with the goal of adding one more study program within the computing discipline, in addition to the Undergraduate Program in Computer Science that had been established in 2002. However, at that time, in the nomenclature rules of the Directorate General of Higher Education (Dikti), the name Information Technology Study Program was not yet known. This study program was still confused with the name of the study program known at that time as the Informatics Study Program, which was actually another name for the Computer Science Study Program. After discussions with the Director General of Higher Education, a decree was finally issued for the establishment of the study program, but under the name of the Undergraduate Program in Software Engineering. Thus, the Undergraduate Program in Software Engineering was officially established in 2007. Through Dikti Decree No. 1629/D/T/2007 dated July 16, 2007. In the early days of its establishment, this study program was managed under the Faculty of Mathematics and Natural Sciences of (FMIPA USU). At the end of 2007, the Decree of the Director General of Higher Education No. 163/KEP/DIKTI/2007, dated November 27, 2007, on the Structuring and Codification of Study Programs in Higher Education Institutions. The naming of undergraduate (S-1) computer study programs is as follows: 1. Informatics Engineering (S-1); 2. Computer Systems (S-1); and 3. Information Systems (S-1) In this naming system, it can be seen that there is no place for the Undergraduate Programs in Computer Science and Software Engineering. Therefore, USU took the policy to adjust the naming of these two study programs to become the Undergraduate Program in Information Systems and the Undergraduate (S-1) Program in Informatics Engineering.

However, the naming system proposed by the Director General of Higher Education received challenges from various higher education institutions, especially those with computer study programs, due to the controversy that arose because many study programs were not accommodated in the new naming system. Asosiasi Perguruan Tinggi Informatika dan Komputer (APTIKOM or the Association of Informatics and Computer Higher Education Institutions) finally resolved this issue by proposing a system of naming and structuring study programs in the field of Informatics and Computers. The result was the Circular Letter of the Director General of Higher Education No. 1030/D/T/2010 on the Structuring of Nomenclature for Psychology, Communication, Computer, and Landscape Study Programs.

arrow_back_ios_new arrow_forward_ios

To become a superior and professional study program in the development of knowledge in the field of Information Technology with emphasis on Data Science and Intelligent System to produce graduates with global competitiveness.

Mission remove To organize education with excellent academic competence and professionalism in mastering the field of Information Technology that is specialized in the fields of Data Science and Intelligent System.

To organize and develop research and dissemination of research results through planned, innovative, and quality scientific publications in accordance with global developments in the fields of Data Science and Intelligent System.

To improve information literacy in society through the application of research results, service, and cooperation to elements of society.

Strengthening cooperation and collaboration across multidisciplinary and multicultural fields through the implementation of the Tri Dharma of higher education.

Goals remove To implement a Competency-Based Curriculum in accordance with the Graduate Profiles to improve the quality of innovative learning management in the Information Technology Study Program, especially in the fields of Data Science and Intelligent System.

To produce graduates who are professional, devoted, innovative, resilient, competent, have a culture of research, have achievements, and have competitive abilities in the field of Information Technology at national and international levels.

To produce research that is innovative, follows technological developments, is community-based, has good scientific ethics in terms of quality and quantity, and is disseminated through scientific papers both nationally and internationally specialized in the fields of Data Science and Intelligent Systems.

To produce research that raises local potential related to culture and history packaged in the form of information technology and disseminated through scientific papers both nationally and internationally.

To organize services, community service activities, and cooperation with the scientific community within the scope of international, university, government, private, and society through the utilization of research laboratories, the channeling of scientific literacy, community problem solving on an ongoing basis in the fields of Data Science and Intelligent System.

To organize community service in the field of information technology that can increase knowledge and open business opportunities for society.

To increase institutional cooperation of Study Programs in the field of Education at national and international levels.

To increase institutional cooperation of Study Programs in the field of Research at national and international levels.

To increase institutional cooperation of Study Programs in the field of Community Service at national and international levels.

Information Technology graduates are able to adapt to innovative Information Technology developments and make decisions on issues in the Information Technology field by identifying and analyzing computational requirements based on the results of a comprehensive analysis of information and data. Using current methodologies, techniques, expertise, tools, and techniques, identifying, analyzing, designing, implementing, and managing problems related to the application of Information Technology. This is done by integrating knowledge related to information technology and computer principles, using effective and efficient algorithms or methods. Maintaining BINTANG values and standards while improving the quality of life of the nation and state.

Learning Outcomes 1 Capable of maintaining an attitude of upholding principles and norms in carrying out responsibilities to improve the nation's and state's quality of life

2 Capable of applying BINTANG values (Fearing God Almighty in the framework of diversity, Innovative with integrity, Tough and Wise)

3 Capable of using logical, analytical, and systematic thinking to fulfill the demands of individuals or organizations and adapting to the development of innovative and fast-moving information technology.

4 Capable of communicating effectively and responsibly to professionals and the general public, both orally and in writing, in transmitting or presenting ideas and well-organized research results.

5 Capable of applying the spirit of responsible leadership, teamwork, entrepreneurship, and independence and collaborating in multidisciplinary and multi-cultural work groups.

6 Capable of making appropriate decisions in the framework of problem-solving in their field of competence based on the outcomes of information and data analysis and effective communication procedures

7 Capable of identifying, analyzing, designing, implementing, and managing the application of information technology using the most recent approaches, techniques, expertise, and tools.

8 Capable of implementing intelligent systems and data science in a specific platform environment to resolve real-world problems using information technology aspects

9 Capable of solving problems by combining qualified knowledge of the functioning principles of information technology and computers with effective and efficient algorithms or methods

The Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) are a set of goals set by the United Nations (UN) to end poverty, protect the environment, and ensure sustainable social, economic, and environmental well-being in the environment, and ensure sustainable social, economic, and environmental well-being worldwide. around the world. These goals were adopted in 2015 through the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development. Development. In an effort to achieve the Sustainable Development Goals, Undergraduate Program in Information Technology contributes to creating ideas that are in line with the 2030 Agenda.

Fasilkom-TI USU held a socialization on Integrity Zone to build a clean, corruption-free campus, with Cholina Trisa Siregar as the speaker.

05 May 2025 News Fasilkom-TI Celebrates Success in PKKMB 2024.

Fasilkom-TI successfully held PKKMB 2024, promoting academic insights, national spirit, environmental awareness, and character development for new students under the theme "Coding Your Dreams."

13 August 2024 News Fasilkom-TI Conducts Practical Lecture on User Experience Design

USU's Faculty of Computer Science held a UX Design practitioner lecture on June 7, 2024. The speaker, Iqbal Muzakki, explained design fundamentals, design thinking, UI design, and UI/UX portfolio.

20 June 2024 News Fasilkom-TI Explores Strategic Cooperation with Asian Institute of Technology (AIT)

Fasilkom-TI USU and AIT Bangkok plan a double degree program in Data Science and AI, starting in 2025-2026, offering 50% tuition waivers and joint thesis supervision.

19 June 2024 News Fasilkom-TI Conducts Field Assessment for Accreditation of S1 Information Technology Program

Fasilkom-TI USU conducted a field assessment for the accreditation of the S1 Information Technology program by LAM INFOKOM, involving visits, criteria discussions, and interviews.

14 June 2024 News Field Assessment of Accreditation of Master of Data Science and Artificial Intelligence Study Program

Fasilkom-TI USU carried out a field assessment of the accreditation of the Master of Data Science and Artificial Intelligence Study Program by LAM INFOKOM on March 20-21, 2023, involving a comprehensive evaluation and interviews.

21 March 2023 News Fasilkom-IT Receives a Visit from SMAN 4 Dumai Fasilkom-TI USU received a visit from SMAN 4 Dumai on January 11, 2023. The visit included speeches, a presentation, and a tour of the facilities before the event concluded.

What Is The Procedure For Conducting The Undergraduate Thesis Examination?

If the student has been declared eligible by the supervisor to take the final examination and has fulfilled the requirements for the final examination, then the student is entitled to take the thesis examination.

Students who have fulfilled the requirements for the thesis examination must fulfill the requirements in the administrative staff at the Vice Dean I to make an invitation for the thesis examination.

Students submit thesis examination invitations to supervisors, examiners and comparison lecturers as well as the administration and administration of the Study Program.

Students are required to be present 15 minutes before the exam takes place

After the exam is over, the supervisor fills out the Thesis Assessment Form and Determination of Final Thesis Examination Passing Status.

Thesis Assessment Form and Determination of Final Thesis Examination Passing Status that has been filled in by the supervisor, comparator and examiner is submitted to the administrative staff at the Vice Dean I.

About Us Education Research Community Service News E-Magazine Faculty News Faculty Agenda Faculty Announcement Faculty Article PPID Executive Staff and Lecturer Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology The Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology lecturers represent academic excellence and are dedicated to guiding students toward success. Each lecturer is not only an expert in their field but also an inspiring mentor and leader in the students' learning journey, bringing valuable experience and a commitment to continuous intellectual growth. The administrative staff provide friendly and efficient service, creating a supportive environment for smooth operations and comfort of the students. With the expertise of the faculty and the dedication of the staff, the Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology is committed to providing an effective learning experience and full support for students' academic success.
