Head of Research, Community Service & Partnerships Subdivision

The academic community is actively involved in various researches that shape the intellectual foundation of the university. From in-depth analysis to innovative exploration, the kaleidoscope of research reflects the diversity of interests and expertise, making valuable contributions to scientific development in various fields. Lecturers, as key contributors, not only act as educators but also shape the direction of the journey of knowledge. This diversity provides significant benefits, not only for the academic development of the university, but also provides relevant solutions to the challenges of the times for the wider community.

Community service is a main pillar for our academic community, which is enthusiastically involved in various initiatives to disseminate the benefits of knowledge outside the university environment. Through community service projects, we utilize the diversity of research to have a direct positive impact on the community. From educational programs to practical solutions for local problems, every effort reflects our active involvement in bridging the divide between the academic world and the real needs of the community. Lecturers, as agents of change, use the diversity of research to create relevant and innovative solutions that provide real benefits in overcoming the challenges faced by today's society.

The program is the foundation for efforts to improve academic quality and professionalism. Lecturers as the main facilitators to encourage participants to explore various learning opportunities and develop additional skills. This program provides opportunities to continuously develop, hone skills, and make better contributions in supporting the university's educational and research missions.

Kuliah Kerja Nyata Tematik Praktisi Mengajar Wirausaha Merdeka IISMA Pertukaran Mahasiswa Merdeka Studi Independen Bersertifikat Magang Bersertifikat Kampus Mengajar More About

The conference is an inspiring platform for exchanging ideas and experiences across various fields. Through presentations and interactions, participants engage in collaborative dialogue, build professional networks, and foster the growth of innovation and knowledge.

Publication is the main means for researchers and academics to disseminate research results and thoughts. Through scientific journals, publications help enrich understanding in various fields and increase visibility and reputation in the academic community. It becomes a key element in advancing knowledge and providing a positive impact on the scientific community.

About Us Education Research Community Service News E-Magazine Faculty News Faculty Agenda Faculty Announcement Faculty Article PPID Executive Dr. Eng

Dr. Eng Ade Candra, S.T., M.Kom.

National Lecturer Registration Number

Study Program Program Studi S2 Teknik Informatika Field Of Knowledge GIS Artificial Intelligence Positions Assistant Professor - Upper Research Media Contacts:

Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology's B Building

Curriculum Vitae file_download Profile

Ade Candra joined as a lecturer in 2009. He got his Bachelor and Master degrees from Universitas Gadjah Mada. Then he received a Doctor of Philosophy in Engineering from Kanazawa University, Japan, in 2019. He has a research interest in Geographic Information Science, Disaster Mitigation, and Mixed Reality.

Studying in Japan has given him opportunities to manage and join some international conferences in Japan and Korea, take VR training by Forum8 in Japan, and take a short course in China. He cooperated with Japan's local disaster prevention community to manage the main evacuation shelter using mixed reality. In Indonesia, he has experience in supporting local government officers to utilize GIS in managing their territory.

He is a Spatial Planning and Sustainable Development (SPSD) community member and editor for the IRSPSD journal. He is also a member of the ICT Volunteer and has experience with the Indonesian and Korean governments for ICT volunteer projects.

Study Program Program Studi S1 Ilmu Komputer Field Of Knowledge Text Processing Artificial Intelligence Positions Associate Professor Research Media Contacts:

Computer Science Study Program, Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology, , Jl. Alumni No.3, Padang Bulan, Kec. Medan Baru, Medan City, North Sumatra 20155

Curriculum Vitae file_download Profile

Mrs. Amalia was born in Banda Aceh on December 21, 1978. She has a bachelor degree in Electrical Engineering from Universitas Syiah Kuala. She then continued her postgraduate education in the Department of Electrical Engineering at and is currently pursuing her doctorate in the Computer Science study program at .

Mrs. Amalia served as Head of the Multimedia Laboratory at Fakultas Ilmu Komputer dan Teknologi Informasi for the period of 2017 - 2021. She already has the position of Assistant Professor, and currently serves as Head of the Computer Science Study Program at Fakultas Ilmu Komputer dan Teknologi Informasi .

Mrs. Amalia's field of research is Natural Language Processing, some of her works in this research field have been published in reputable journals both nationally and internationally.

Never stop learning because life never stops teaching is the life motto that Amalia always holds.

About Us Education Research Community Service News E-Magazine Faculty News Faculty Agenda Faculty Announcement Faculty Article PPID Executive

Anandhini Medianty Nababan, M.T

National Lecturer Registration Number

Study Program Program Studi S1 Ilmu Komputer Field Of Knowledge Software Engineering Positions Assistant Professor - Lower Research Media Contacts:

Jalan Universitas No. 9A Kampus USU Medan

Curriculum Vitae file_download Profile

Mrs. Anandini Medianty Nababan, who is often called Dhini, is a woman of genuine Batak blood. She was born in Medan, on April 13, 1993. She attended formal education from elementary to undergraduate in Medan. After graduating from the Computer Science Undergraduate Study Program at (USU), she continued her education in the Informatics Master Study Program at Institut Teknologi Bandung (ITB) by receiving a scholarship from Lembaga Pengelola Dana Pendidikan (LPDP).

Mrs. Dhini presented her thesis research in 2019 at the International Conference on Electrical Engineering and Informatics (ICEEI), one of the IEEE conferences, in Bandung. She had worked at Xtremax Bandung and PT. Sanggar Jaya Abadi as a software developer, now she is a programming instructor at Binus Center, in addition to being a lecturer at the Computer Science Undergraduate Study Program USU.

When Bu Dhini was young, she won several singing contests in Gereja Batak Karo Protestan (GBKP). She is still active as a song leader in the church until now. In addition, she also teaches Sunday school for children and youth at GBKP. Her other organizational activity is managing Mata Garuda LPDP.

Mrs. Dhini has attended several trainings, namely the Cisco Python Professional Academy Program and CCNA Network Engineer for Trainers from the Digital Talent Scholarship, as well as the Bina Nusantara In House Training Program in Implementation of Java. She realized that we should be grateful for everything that we have as it is a gift from God. Our job is to learn to be content and “to make the best of what we have”. Next, leave the results to the Creator because He knows what is best for us.

Making the best of what you have

National Lecturer Registration Number

Study Program Program Studi S1 Teknologi Informasi Field Of Knowledge Artificial Intelligence Computer Vision Positions Assistant Professor - Upper Research Media Contacts:

Jalan Universitas No. 9A Kampus USU Medan

Curriculum Vitae file_download Profile

Mr. Dedy Arisandi ST, M.Kom was born in Medan on August 31, 1979. He completed his undergraduate education in Sekolah Tinggi Teknik Harapan Medan in 2003 and completed his Masters in Teknologi Informasi di Universitas Putra Indonesia in 2009. Mr. Dedy Arisandi's training was on Database Design and Programming with SQL from Oracle Academy in 2020.

Mr. Dedy started his career at the University of North Sumatra in 2009. He held a structural position for the first time as Head of the Programming Laboratory from 2012 to 2017, followed by an expert dean staff from 2016 to 2017. After that, Mr. Dedy held the position of Head of the Database Laboratory for the period 2017 to 2021, followed by the manager of the Data Center and Information Systems at the USU Quality Management Unit for the 2018-2021 period. Mr. Dedy has held the position of Secretary of the S-1 Information Technology Study Program at USU's Facilkom-TI for the 2021-2026. Mr. Dedy's research interests include Intelligent Systems, Computer Vision, and Machine Learning.

Throughout his life journey, Mr. Dedy always motivates himself by remembering the advice he received during his lifetime: "Demanding knowledge is an effort made to change behavior towards a better direction because knowledge leads to truth and leaves ignorance. Verily, Allah hates those who are clever in the world's affairs but ignorant in the affairs of the hereafter. The most intelligent people are the ones who remember death the most and are best prepared to face what comes after."

Dr. Erna Budhiarti Nababan, M.IT

National Lecturer Registration Number

Study Program Program Studi S2 Sains Data dan Kecerdasan Buatan Field Of Knowledge Artificial Intelligence Machine Learning Optimization Positions Associate Professor Research Media Contacts:

Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology's E Building

Curriculum Vitae file_download Profile

Dr. Erna Budhiarti Nababan is an accomplished lecturer in the Master's Program in Data Science and Artificial Intelligence at . Born in Bandung on October 26, 1962, she brings a wealth of knowledge and experience to her students. Her academic journey includes a Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering from IKIP Bandung, a Master's in Industrial Computing from Universiti Kebangsaan Malaysia, and a Doctorate in Science and Management Systems from the same institution. With her expertise in Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, and Optimization, Dr. Erna is committed to fostering a dynamic learning environment that encourages students to explore innovative solutions in data science.

In her teaching, Dr. Erna emphasizes the integration of theoretical concepts with practical applications, preparing her students to tackle real-world challenges in the field of technology. Her dedication to education extends beyond the classroom, as she actively participates in research projects and collaborates with industry partners. By instilling a strong foundation in AI and machine learning, she aims to equip her students with the skills necessary to excel in a rapidly evolving technological landscape.

National Lecturer Registration Number

Study Program Program Studi S1 Ilmu Komputer Field Of Knowledge Internet of Thing (IoT) Artificial Intelligence of Things (AIoT) Data Science Positions Assistant Professor - Lower Research Media Contacts:

Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology's D Building

Curriculum Vitae file_download Profile

Bu Uun; that's what Mrs. Hayatunnufus is usually called. She was born in Koto Majidin Mudik on July 19, 1992. Mrs. Uun graduated from the Computer Science Undergraduate Program of (USU) and the Computer Science Master Program of Universitas Gadjah Mada (UGM). During her studies, she always received PPA scholarships during her undergraduate education and excellent scholarships from the Ministry of Education and Culture while pursuing her master's degree.

Mrs. Uun has been a teacher since college, first as a lecturer assistant and lab assistant. Her teaching duties continued at SMK Islam Teknologi Marinah Al-Hidayah Medan, where she taught Photography, Graphic Design, and Software Engineering. Now, she is a lecturer at the Computer Science Undergraduate Study Program, Fasilkom-TI USU, and she has been trusted several times as an instructor for the Digital Talent Scholarship (DTS) of USU.

The organizations that Mrs. Uun has participated in are IMILKOM USU (as secretary for the student affairs area), PEMA Fasilkom-TI (as a member of the public relations area), IKLC USU (as a member of the scientific development team), UKMI Al-Khuwarizmi Fasilkom-TI (as a member), Science and Technology Forum UGM (as a research member), HIMPASIKOM UGM (as general treasurer), Postgraduate Student Association UGM (as a member of the research and technology team), Paradigm Journal UGM (as field secretary), Research Lab SKJ UGM (as a member), G-Connect UGM (as a part of landslide disaster mitigation data team), and the Indonesian Cancer Foundation in North Sumatra (as head of IT).

Currently, Mrs. Uun is actively participating as a staff of the Institute for Curriculum and Learning Innovation (LINK-UP USU), as a member of the Indonesia Collaboration Research - UGM Jogja Tanggap Covid, as a member of the Covid-19 information system development team UGM, and as a North Sumatra ICT volunteer. Meanwhile, her research areas of interest are IoT, AIoT, and data science. She has attended several training sessions on topics related to this field. She adheres to the principle of "Be Nice, Be Genuine".

Curriculum Vitae file_download Profile

Mr. Ivan Jaya, S.Si, M.Kom was born in Jakarta, on July 7, 1984. He started his studies in Sumatra, namely, at . He completed an Undergraduate program in Mathematics at FMIPA USU and a Master's in Informatics Engineering at Fasilkom-TI USU. He is also pursuing a Doctorate in Computer Science at Fasilkom-TI USU.

Mr. Ivan started his career as a lecturer at Facilkom-TI USU in 2016 until now teaching web programming. Not only as a teaching staff, Mr. Ivan has also held a quality assurance group for Fasilkom-TI USU. He has served as an expert staff for the Dean of Research, Community Service, and Quality Management at Fasilkom-TI USU.

Mr. Ivan's research area is about machine learning. He has also received several achievements during his career in education, such as Certified Data Center Professional - Exin (2019 - 2022), Microsoft Certified: Azure Fundamentals (2021), and Microsoft Certified: Azure Data Fundamentals (2021).

In his achievements during his career journey, he never forgets some of the advice he got from the people closest to him, namely

- The best human being is the one who can benefit others; - Bind knowledge by writing it down; and - Always remember Allah, be grateful for His blessings, and worship Him as best you can.

Curriculum Vitae file_download Profile

Dr. Jos Timanta Tarigan S.Kom., M.Sc was born in Medan on January 26, 1985. Mr. Jos earned his bachelor degree of Computer Science Undergraduate Program at Universitas Indonesia in 2006. Two years after he completed his undergraduate study, he continued his study for a master degree in Advanced Computer Graphics at Linkoping University, Sweden. He then received his master degree in 2011. Currently, he is pursuing his doctoral education at , Computer Science Study Program.

Dr. Jos started his career as a programmer at Jatis Ecom from 2006 to 2007 and then from 2007 to 2008 at Perusahaan Cherrypick Indonesia. Then he continued his career as a programmer at Perusahan Jawasoft Indonesia in 2008. Mr. Jos started his career as a lecturer from 2012 to 2015 at STMIK Kristen Neumann Indonesia. After that, starting from 2015 until now he has become a permanent lecturer at .

Dr. Jos' field of research is related to the field of Computer Graphics, Game Development.

Dr. Mohammad Andri Budiman, S.T., M.Comp.Sc., M.E.M.

National Lecturer Registration Number

Study Program Program Studi S2 Teknik Informatika Field Of Knowledge Cryptography Design and Analysis of Algorithm Positions Vice Dean for Academic Affairs, Student Affairs and Alumni Assistant Professor - Upper Research Media Contacts:

Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology Jl. University No. 9-A USU Campus Medan 20155

Curriculum Vitae file_download Profile

Dr. Mohammad Andri Budiman was born in Medan on October 8, 1975. He holds a bachelor's degree in Engineering from ITB, a Master of Computer Science degree from University of New South Wales, Sydney, Australia and a Master of Engineering Management from University of Technology, Sydney, Australia. In 2021 he earned his doctoral degree from the Doctoral Program in Computer Science at .

From 2009–2017, Dr. Mohammad Andri Budiman was secretary of Master’s Program in Informatics Fasilkom-TI USU. During that time, he also appointed as Chair of the USU ICT Task Force (2012-2013), member of the USU senate (2013-2014), member of Team Formulator of USU's Strategic Plan and RPJM (2014), and Chair of Fasilkom-TI Advisory Council for the 2013-2017 period. From 2017 to 2021, he appointed as head of Fasilkom-TI Algorithm and Programming Laboratory, and currently Dr. Mohammad Andri Budiman is Vice Dean I for Academic, Student Affairs and Alumni, Fasilkom-TI.

Dr. Mohammad Andri Budiman is certified as a Java Programmer from Sun Microsystems, United States of America. He loved by his students, therefore for 2 consecutive years (2013-2014) he won the position of Favorite Lecturer in S-1 Computer Science Study Program. At the 2015 USU Anniversary, he was the second best presenter in the Lecturer Category. Not only that, his ability as a lecturer was also recognized by getting the Best Lecturer at the 2019 Fasilkom-TI Awards. Mr. Mohammad Andri Budiman also has a high IQ, so he can join the Member of IHIQS (The International High IQ Society) in 2016 and Member of Mensa International High IQ Society in 2017.

The best human being is the most beneficial to others.

Love those on earth, surely those in the sky will love you.

Let's dhikr as much as possible, do our best, worship as solemnly as possible.

Achieve His forgiveness, reward, love, pleasure, and paradise.

The world is temporary, the hereafter is forever.

Dr. Pauzi Ibrahim Nainggolan, S.Komp., M.Sc.

National Lecturer Registration Number

Study Program Program Studi S1 Ilmu Komputer Field Of Knowledge Computer Vision Artificial Intelligence Software Engineering Positions Assistant Professor - Lower Research Media Contacts:

Gedung C Fasilkom-TI, , Jl. Alumni No.3, Padang Bulan, Kec. Medan Baru, Medan City, North Sumatra 20155

Curriculum Vitae file_download Profile

Pauzi Ibrahim Nainggolan, born on September 14, 1988, in Kajang, Malaysia, completed his undergraduate education in 2012 at Bogor Agricultural University, followed by a Master of Science education at Universiti Kebangsaan Malaysia. He is currently pursuing his Ph.D program at . Mr. Pauzi was called to join the 8th Taplai Lemhannas Ri in 2014.

In 2012, he became a Research Assistant at the Institute of Visual Informatics. Starting his career as a permanent lecturer at the University of North Sumatra from 2020, Mr. Pauzi was involved as an Expert for the Communication and Informatics Office of Medan City in 2021. Mr. Pauzi was once asked for an opinion as an IT expert in a land dispute case at the Sidikalang District Court.

About Us Education Research Community Service News E-Magazine Faculty News Faculty Agenda Faculty Announcement Faculty Article PPID Executive Prof. Dr.

Prof. Dr. Romi Fadillah Rahmat, B.Comp.Sc., M.Sc.

National Lecturer Registration Number

Study Program Program Studi S1 Teknologi Informasi Field Of Knowledge Image Processing Machine Learning Brain-Like Computing Positions Vice Dean for Research, Community Service, Cooperation and Information

Professor Research Media Contacts:

3rd Floor Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology's A Building

Curriculum Vitae file_download Profile

Mr. Romi Fadillah Rahmat, born on March 3, 1986, in Jakarta, he completed his Bachelor of Computer Science (Hons) in 2007 at Universiti Sains Malaysia, then he continued with his master degree in Science at the same university. He is currently pursuing his doctorate at .

Starting his career as a permanent lecturer at from 2010, Mr. Romi held the position of Head of Information Technology Undergraduate Study Program from 2017-2021. His career at the university continued after being appointed as Secretary of Academic Senate USU for the period of 2019-2024. Then in 2021 he was appointed as Vice Dean III for Research, Community Service, Cooperation and Information. Previously he was also trusted as an ITE expert by most of the police in the North Sumatra Region. Mr. Romi has also been an expert and consultant for NGO Caritas for the Tsunami recovery program in Meulaboh, he was also involved as an expert consultant for application development at the Medan City Revenue Service from 2011-2014, and he served as Head IT Consultant for PT. Dhiarga in Medan. In 2019, Mr Romi was also involved in an orangutan monitoring project funded by USAID in Banda Aceh.

Mr. Romi Fadillah Rahmat started his research while studying for his master degree in Malaysia, with the focus of his research at that time on Brain-like Computing using the Distributed Adaptive Neuro-Gen Learning Engine, which is one of the novel methods he invented. Then Mr. Romi also received 17 research grants from 2014 until now, both from the Ministry of Education and Culture funds and from the Talenta USU research fund. His research interests are brain-like computing, image processing, image vision, deep learning, virtual reality, real-time processing, and data analytics. He has published more than 100 publications with 10 international journal articles. He won 2nd place as the Best Researcher in 2018 from USU.

Assistant Professor - Upper Research Media Contacts:

Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology's C Building

Curriculum Vitae file_download Profile

Mrs. Sarah Purnamawati is a distinguished lecturer in the Undergraduate Program in Information Technology at , where she specializes in Database Systems, Artificial Intelligence, and Information System Management. With her extensive knowledge and experience, she is dedicated to equipping her students with the skills necessary to navigate the rapidly changing technology landscape. Mrs. Sarah emphasizes hands-on learning, encouraging students to apply theoretical concepts to real-world scenarios, thereby enhancing their problem-solving abilities.

In addition to her teaching responsibilities, Mrs. Purnamawati serves as the Vice Dean for Administration, Finance, Human Resources, and Assets, where she plays a critical role in the operational management of the faculty. Her leadership ensures that the administrative aspects of the program run smoothly, allowing both students and faculty to focus on academic excellence. Committed to fostering an inclusive and supportive educational environment, she actively engages with students to understand their needs and aspirations, helping them achieve their academic goals.

About Us Education Research Community Service News E-Magazine Faculty News Faculty Agenda Faculty Announcement Faculty Article PPID Executive Building the Foundation for a Digital Future Master&#039;s Program in Data Science and Artificial Intelligence

General Information About Academic Research & Service Alumni Activities SDGs

As an advanced study program after the Undergraduate Programs in Computer Science & Information Technology, the Master's Program in Data Science and Artificial Intelligence of (USU) focuses on developing its students' capabilities in two specific areas, namely data science and artificial intelligence. Data science is a discipline that combines knowledge in a field with skills in programming, mathematics, and statistics, aiming to extract information or knowledge from data. Meanwhile, artificial intelligence focuses on solving problems related to human cognitive functions, such as machine learning, problem solving, and pattern recognition, which are then applied in technology.

Supported by experts with international expertise and backed by an integrated curriculum, we have a deep commitment to prepare our students to take on the role of technopreneurs and IT experts who excel in their fields and can compete in the national and international markets. Graduates of our program have great opportunities for careers as data scientists and artificial intelligence developers.

To become a leading master’s study program in the field of data science and artificial intelligence that produces competent graduates with global competitiveness and is recognized at the international level by 2024.

Mission remove To develop new specialized curricula and an innovative M.Sc. program on Data Science and Artificial Intelligence, thus helping build the capacity of the Asian partner countries’ (PC) HEIs, improve the level of competencies and skills offered, and address the existing absence of a similar programme.

To promote cooperation, exchange of know-how and good practices in Αsia between EU and PC HEIs.

Establish viable synergies and links with the regional IT Industry in order to address their needs in specialised personnel in DS&AI, training needs and enhance the employability of DS&AI graduates.

Goals remove Our program has been meticulously crafted to furnish students with the essential knowledge and expertise required to spearhead innovation and adaptation in alignment with the contemporary challenges.

Within this educational framework, students are encouraged to delve into the intricacies of data, algorithmic advancements, machine learning, and the practical deployment of artificial intelligence across diverse business and technological scenarios.

Recognizing that innovation thrives in a collaborative environment, we foster interdisciplinary cooperation and have forged partnerships with a multitude of institutions and industries to ensure that our educational offerings remain pertinent and actionable in real-world settings.

Dr. Erna Budhiarti Nababan M.IT Head Of Master Program In Data Science And Artificial Intelligence

Dr. Baihaqi Siregar S.Si., M.T.

Dr. Marischa Elveny S.TI., M.Kom.

Dr. Muhammad Anggia Muchtar S.T., MM.IT.

About Us Education Research Community Service News E-Magazine Faculty News Faculty Agenda Faculty Announcement Faculty Article PPID Executive Building the Foundation for a Digital Future Master&#039;s Program in Informatics Engineering General Information About Academic Research & Service Alumni Activities SDGs

As an advanced study program after the Undergraduate Programs in Computer Science & Information Technology, the Master's Program in Informatics Engineering of (USU) has a primary focus on equipping students with in-depth insights, technical expertise, and world-class competencies to compete in the global market.

Supported by lecturers who are experts in the field of informatics engineering with national teaching certificates and supported by an integrated curriculum, we have a deep commitment to providing intensive and effective guidance and learning experiences to our students. Our goal is to enhance students' abilities and prepare them to take on the role of technopreneurs and IT experts who are competent in their fields, as well as excellent and able to compete in the national and international markets. Graduates of the Master's Program in Informatics Engineering are expected to pursue professions in various technology fields, including technopreneurship, IT consultants, data scientists, etc.

The Master’s Program in Informatics Engineering aims to educate students to become experts in the field of computer science or informatics engineering who are able to develop science and its applications, conduct research, design and implement software, and be able to solve computational problems in various fields. Since its establishment to date (2009 to 2013), the Master’s Program in Informatics Engineering has produced 85 alumni and the graduates are given the M.Kom. (Master of Computer) degree. Now, the study program is also under the auspices of the Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology.

The Master’s Program in Informatics Engineering aims to educate students to become experts in the field of computer science or informatics engineering who are able to develop science and its applications, conduct research, design and implement software, and be able to solve computational problems in various fields. Since its establishment (2009) to 2013, the Master’s Program in Informatics Engineering has produced 85 alumni, and the graduates are given the M.Kom. (Master of Computer) degree. Now, the study program is also under the auspices of the Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology.

To become a Study Program that excels in Education, Research, and Social Contribution nationally and internationally in the field of informatics engineering, especially in the fields of Cyber Security, Machine Learning, and the Internet of Things.

Mission remove To organize and develop national and international quality education and research in the field of Informatics Engineering, especially Cyber Security, Machine Learning, and the Internet of Things.

To develop and disseminate innovative science and technology that can make social contributions in the frame of Tropical Science and Medicine, Agroindustry, Local Wisdom, Energy [sustainable], Natural Resources [biodiversity, forest marine, mine, tourism], Technology [appropriate] and Arts [ethnic] (TALENTA) USU.

To utilize science and technology for the welfare and progress of the nation through the organization of research and community service activities while upholding ethical and moral values.

Goals remove To educate and produce graduates who have the core values of BINTANG (Devoted to Almighty God in the frame of diversity, Innovative and Has Integrity, Resilient and Wise) who can solve problems through science and technology of informatics engineering.

To educate and produce graduates who have high insight through excellent research in the fields of Cyber Security, Machine Learning, and the Internet of Things.

To educate and produce graduates who are able to develop and apply science and technology to produce research that is innovative, adaptive, noble, and disseminated through scientific works with national and international reputations.

To educate and produce graduates who are able to think critically and innovatively in their work while upholding the professional code of ethics.

Dr. Eng Ade Candra S.T., M.Kom.

> News > Alibaba Cloud Conducts Workshop on Understanding the World of Cloud Computing at USU's Fasilkom-TI

Alibaba Cloud Conducts Workshop on Understanding the World of Cloud Computing at USU's Fasilkom-TI

Thumbnail Alibaba Cloud Conducts Workshop on Understanding the World of Cloud Computing at USU's Fasilkom-TI

Alibaba Cloud has conducted a workshop on Understanding the World of Cloud Computing at the Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology (Fasilkom-TI), (USU). This workshop was held at the USU Faculty of Economics and Business (FEB) Hall on Wednesday, September 13, 2022.

Alibaba Cloud has conducted a workshop on Understanding the World of Cloud Computing at the Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology (Fasilkom-TI), (USU). This workshop was held at the USU Faculty of Economics and Business (FEB) Hall on Wednesday, September 13, 2022.

Alibaba Cloud is the digital technology and intelligence backbone of Alibaba Group, and one of the world's three leading IaaS (Infrastructure as a Service) providers. Alibaba Cloud is also the most significant public cloud service provider in China. Currently, Alibaba Cloud has 3 Data Centers (Data Center) and 1 Scrubbing Center in Indonesia. This workshop is a form of support and cooperation from Fasilkom-TI towards Alibaba Cloud.

The workshop began with an opening by the MC (Master Ceremony) followed by remarks from the Dean of Fasilkom-TI, Dr. Maya Silvi Lydia, B.Sc, M.Sc. In his speech, the Dean of Fasilkom-TI said that cloud computing can help make decisions from big data to be efficient with a high priority scale. He also added that this activity is the first step for cooperation with Alibaba Cloud.

Then, Aaron Berliano Handoko, Alibaba Cloud Indonesia Marketing Technical Manager, presented material. The presentation began with an introduction to cloud computing and its application in everyday life. The material continued with an introduction to Alibaba Cloud and its products. The participants who attended received a certificate from Alibaba Cloud.

> News > Collaborative Visit Between Fasilkom-TI USU and Universiti Putra Malaysia

Collaborative Visit Between Fasilkom-TI USU and Universiti Putra Malaysia

Thumbnail Collaborative Visit Between Fasilkom-TI USU and Universiti Putra Malaysia

Fasilkom-TI USU visited UPM to discuss collaboration on internships, research, student and exchanges, and implementing an offshore program designed by UPM at USU.

The Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology (Fasilkom-TI) of (USU) conducted a collaborative visit to Universiti Putra Malaysia (UPM) on Tuesday, November 29, 2022.

The representatives from Fasilkom-TI included the Dean, Dr. Maya Silvi Lydia, B.Sc, M.Sc., Vice Dean for Research, Community Service, Cooperation, and Information, Romi Fadillah Rahmat, B.Comp.Sc., M.Sc., Expert Staff for Human Resources and Finance, Pauzi Ibrahim Nainggolan, M.Sc., Head of the Master's Program in Data Science and Artificial Intelligence, Dr. Erna Budhiarti Nababan, M.IT, Head of the Information Systems Center (PSI) at USU, Mohammad Fadly Syah Putra, B.Sc., M.Sc., and Public Relations Staff of Fasilkom-TI, Rhama Permadi Ahmad, S.Kom.

The collaboration agenda covered discussions on internships for undergraduate and master's programs, mobility programs, research collaboration, offshore programs, exchange programs, jointly/dual programs, journals, conferences, research/grant collaboration, and staff exchanges between the two universities. The offshore program, designed by UPM, includes its curriculum and will be implemented at USU.

Additionally, student mobility was addressed through a student exchange program, where both USU and UPM will send their students for the exchange. Eligible students are those in their 4th to 6th semesters, allowing them to work on their theses elsewhere and still graduate on time. For staff exchange, UPM will invite USU lecturers to teach, conduct research, and engage in discussions.

> News > Fani Windari Wins 2nd Place at the AORTA Innovation Challenge

Fani Windari Wins 2nd Place at the AORTA Innovation Challenge

Thumbnail Fani Windari Wins 2nd Place at the AORTA Innovation Challenge

Fani Windari, a USU student, won 2nd place at the AORTA Innovation Challenge 2024, showcasing innovation in youth health and inspiring future generations.

Fani Windari, a student in the Bachelor of Information Technology program from the 2021 cohort, has successfully brought recognition to (USU) by securing 2nd place in the Higher Education category at the AORTA Innovation Challenge (AIC) organized by ASTRA in Jakarta on August 30, 2024.

The AORTA Innovation Challenge (AIC) is a prestigious annual event focused on health innovation. This competition invites participants from various backgrounds, ranging from high school students to university students, to generate creative ideas that support youth health and positively impact the wider community.

In this competition, Fani presented her outstanding innovation, which received praise from the judges, earning her a second-place finish in the higher education category. This achievement is not only a point of pride for Fani but also for the entire academic community at USU, particularly the Faculty of Computer Science - Information Technology (Fasilkom - TI). This success demonstrates their ability to compete at the national level and contribute meaningfully to creating health solutions for young people.

The AIC, held annually by ASTRA, reflects the company's commitment to supporting health innovation, especially focusing on critical issues such as youth health. Through this platform, participants are challenged to develop ideas that are not only creative but also applicable in daily life, with the potential to make a positive impact on their communities.

With this achievement, Fani is expected to inspire other students to continue developing creativity and innovation, particularly in the field of health. May more young generations be motivated to innovate for a healthier and more prosperous Indonesia.

Congratulations to Fani Windari on her achievement!

> News > Fasilkom-IT Receives a Visit from SMAN 4 Dumai

Fasilkom-IT Receives a Visit from SMAN 4 Dumai Published At

Thumbnail Fasilkom-IT Receives a Visit from SMAN 4 Dumai Fasilkom-TI USU received a visit from SMAN 4 Dumai on January 11, 2023. The visit included speeches, a presentation, and a tour of the facilities before the event concluded.

The Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology (Fasilkom-TI) of the (USU) received a visit from the SMA Negeri (SMAN) 4 Dumai on Wednesday, January 11 2023 in the Seminar Room of Building D Fasilkom-TI.

The visit was opened by the Academic Expert Staff of the Dean I of Fasilkom-TI, Amer Sharif, S.Si., M.Kom., and was followed by a speech by the Dean of Fasilkom-TI, Dr. Maya Silvi Lydia, B.Sc, M.Sc., and a speech from the Head of SMAN 4 Dumai Halinis, S.Si. In his speech, he hoped that the students of SMAN 4 Dumai could continue their higher education at USU, especially in Fasilkom-TI.

The event continued with a presentation on Fasilkom-TI by the Deputy Dean I Expert Staff Dewi Sartika, S.Kom., M.Kom. In her presentation, she explained what would be studied later, the admission paths to USU, scholarships available, and the research carried out by the lecturers or students of Fasilkom-TI.

Next, they visited the facilities available in Fasilkom-TI, including the multimedia lab, the Information System Center (PSI), and the Data Science and Artificial Intelligence Lab (DSAI). The event was closed with a exchange of souvenirs by the Dean of Fasilkom-TI.

> News > Fasilkom-TI Achieve Four Awards at the 70th Anniversary Open Senate Session of USU

Fasilkom-TI Achieve Four Awards at the 70th Anniversary Open Senate Session of USU

Thumbnail Fasilkom-TI Achieve Four Awards at the 70th Anniversary Open Senate Session of USU

Fasilkom-TI USU won four awards at USU's 70th Anniversary, including top rankings in academic excellence and recognition for faculty contributions and program accreditation.

Medan, Fasilkom-TI Public Relations – (USU) held its 70th Anniversary Open Senate Session on Thursday, October 21, 2022, at the USU Auditorium, with the theme "Towards Entrepreneurial University."

The event was opened by the Rector of , Dr. Muryanto Amin, S.Sos., M.Sc., followed by remarks from the Governor of North Sumatra, Edy Rahmayadi, and a virtual address from the President of the Republic of Indonesia, Joko Widodo.

In his report, the Rector of USU stated that the university had achieved national recognition, ranking 12th among the top universities in the country. Additionally, USU entered the 1,201+ ranking in the QS World University (WU) Ranking 2021, marking the first time USU had been included in this ranking.

By 2039, USU aims to become a university with academic excellence, serving as a "barometer of scientific progress capable of competing globally," Muryanto concluded.

The Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology (Fasilkom-TI) won four awards during the 70th Anniversary Open Senate Session of USU. The Bachelor’s program in Computer Science earned second place in the Key Performance Indicators (IKU) 5 category for faculty work that has been utilized by the community or received international recognition. Additionally, the Bachelor’s programs in Computer Science and Information Technology received the USU 2022 Accreditation of Excellence Award. Furthermore, Fasilkom-TI's Vice Dean 3, Romi Fadillah Rahmat, B.Comp.Sc. M.Sc., secured third place in the Most Cited Contributor Award.

> News > Fasilkom-TI and FMIPA UGM Successfully Conduct Focus Group Discussion (FGD) on Knowledge Management Based on COVID-19 Mitigation Analysis with Big Data

Fasilkom-TI and FMIPA UGM Successfully Conduct Focus Group Discussion (FGD) on Knowledge Management Based on COVID-19 Mitigation Analysis with Big Data

Thumbnail Fasilkom-TI and FMIPA UGM Successfully Conduct Focus Group Discussion (FGD) on Knowledge Management Based on COVID-19 Mitigation Analysis with Big Data

The USU and UGM held a COVID-19 Knowledge Management FGD on August 2, 2024, supported by BRIN, focusing on big data analytics and mitigation strategies.

The Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology (Fasilkom-TI) of (USU), in collaboration with the Faculty of Mathematics and Natural Sciences (FMIPA) of Universitas Gadjah Mada, conducted a Focus Group Discussion (FGD) on Knowledge Management based on COVID-19 Mitigation Analysis using Big Data. This event was supported by the National Research and Innovation Agency (BRIN) for the 2023-2024 Research and Innovation Program for Advanced Indonesia. The discussion took place on Friday, August 2, 2024, at the Hall of the Faculty of Nursing, . The event was also supported by the Provincial Government of North Sumatra and the North Sumatra Health Office.

The objective of this event was to explore COVID-19 knowledge in Big Data Management and COVID-19 Analytics on a national scale, and to establish a Data Analytics facility for executing use cases and analytical scenarios that support decision-making for mitigation efforts.

The event began with participant registration, followed by the singing of the national anthem "Indonesia Raya," a prayer, an opening speech by the Dean of Fasilkom-TI, Dr. Maya Silvi Lydia B.Sc., M.Sc., and remarks from the Lead Researcher, Dr. Mardhani Riasetiawan. There was also a plaque presentation, a group photo session, and an opening speech by the Head of the Emerging Infectious Diseases Handling Team of North Sumatra Province, Dr. Restuti Hidayani Saragih, Sp.PD, K-PTI, FINASIM, M.H.(Kes).

The first presentation was delivered by the Head of the North Sumatra Provincial Health Office, Drs. Basarin Yunus Tanjung, M.Si, with the title "Management of COVID-19 Handling in North Sumatra." In his presentation, he reviewed the history of COVID-19 cases in North Sumatra, starting with the first positive case on March 17, 2020. He then explained the health services provided in North Sumatra to handle COVID-19 cases, such as COVID-19 referral hospitals, digital tracing implementation, testing and treatment (3T), epidemiological investigations, periodic testing in workplaces, community activity restrictions, and more.

The next session covered the management of COVID-19 handling in various regions such as Medan City, Deli Serdang, Pematang Siantar, Simalungun, and Serdang Bedagai. The presentations were delivered by the respective Heads of the Regional Health Offices. Key points in these presentations included reports on the number of COVID-19 cases in each region, the challenges faced in handling the cases, and the steps taken by the Health Offices.

Following the presentations, the FGD sessions were conducted. The first FGD session was moderated by Dr. Inke Nadia Diniyanti Lubis M.Ked(Ped)., Sp.A, Ph.D, and the second session was moderated by Dr. Siti Zahara Nasution S.Kp., MNS. During these sessions, FGD participants, including Hospital Directors from North Sumatra, doctors involved during the COVID-19 pandemic, nurses, analysts, pharmacists, surveillance officers, law enforcers, business actors, the Head of the North Sumatra Province National Unity and Politics Agency, religious leaders, scout volunteers, Bhabinkamtibmas from Medan Belawan Police, and media representatives, discussed the scope of knowledge management for COVID-19 from various points of view such as community empowerment, data perspective, technology perspective, legality of implementation, and all aspects concerning the situation during the COVID-19 pandemic. The event concluded with the presentation of souvenirs and a group photo session.

> News > Fasilkom-TI Celebrates Success in PKKMB 2024.

Fasilkom-TI Celebrates Success in PKKMB 2024.

Thumbnail Fasilkom-TI Celebrates Success in PKKMB 2024.

Fasilkom-TI successfully held PKKMB 2024, promoting academic insights, national spirit, environmental awareness, and character development for new students under the theme "Coding Your Dreams."

The Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology (Fasilkom-TI) at (USU) successfully held its Introduction to Campus Life for New Students (PKKMB) from Tuesday to Thursday, August 13-15, 2024, with the theme “Coding Your Dreams: Weave Your Future.” The three-day event began with a grand opening at the USU Mini Stadium, where the Rector of USU, Prof. Dr. Muryanto Amin, S.Sos, M. Si, officially inaugurated the PKKMB. Following the opening, students were mobilized to their respective faculties.

The first day featured welcoming speeches from the PKKMB Chair of Fasilkom-TI, the Chair of the Student Government (Pema) of Fasilkom-TI, and an introduction to the faculty leadership by the Dean of Fasilkom-TI, Dr. Maya Silvi Lydia B.Sc., M.Sc. This session was designed to help new students get to know the faculty leaders, fostering a sense of closeness and camaraderie between students and the faculty. Additionally, the session covered the vision and mission of Fasilkom-TI to help students understand the educational goals and direction of their studies.

The first day also included a presentation on National Insight by Computer Science Lecturer Pauzi Ibrahim Nainggolan, S.Kom., M.Sc. The presentation covered three key points: Pancasila, the 1945 Constitution, the Unitary State of the Republic of Indonesia (NKRI), and the principle of Bhinneka Tunggal Ika; prevention and countering of intolerance, radicalism, terrorism, and opposing ideologies; and national defense and mental revolution. This material aimed to build students' strong national awareness, responsibility as citizens, and readiness to contribute positively to the nation.

The second presentation of the day was on Core Values in the Digital Era, delivered by the Head of the Computer Science Program, Dr. Amalia, S.T., M.T. This session addressed cultural values, ethics, etiquette, and responsible use of social media. The goal was for students to develop strong character, understand cultural values and ethics, and apply them in the digital world, equipping them with the skills and knowledge needed to use digital technology, particularly social media, wisely and responsibly.

The third presentation was by the Head of the Information Technology Program, Dedy Arisandi, S.T., M.Kom., on the topic of the Higher Education System in Indonesia. This session aimed to provide a comprehensive understanding of the higher education system in Indonesia and specifically at USU, helping students to maximize their academic experiences and understand the Merdeka Belajar policy to achieve their academic and professional goals.

The final presentation of the first day was on Priority Competitions by Information Technology Lecturer Rossy Nurhasanah, S.Kom., M.Kom. The session outlined several key competitions available to Fasilkom-TI students, such as the National Student Technology and Information Communication Exhibition (GEMASTIK) and the National Student Scientific Week (PIMNAS).

The second day started with student registration and a group exercise session. It continued with a presentation on Higher Education in the Era of Industrial Revolution by the Secretary of the Information Technology Program, Ivan Jaya, S.Si., M.Kom. This presentation focused on how higher education institutions adapt and contribute to the significant changes brought by the Fourth Industrial Revolution. The second presentation was by the Secretary of the Master’s Program in Informatics, Dr. Jos Timanta Tarigan, S.Kom., M.Sc., on Environmental Awareness and a Healthy Campus. The goal was to encourage students to actively participate in creating a clean, healthy, and corruption-free campus environment while maintaining and developing good mental health and character.

The third presentation of the day was by Information Technology Lecturer Fanindia Purnamasari, S.TI., M.IT., on Intellectual Character and Anti-Violence. This session aimed to equip students with the knowledge and skills needed to develop intellectual character and address violence issues, particularly bullying and sexual violence. The final presentation of the day was on USU-related topics by Computer Science Lecturer Amer Sharif, S.Si., M.Kom. This session focused on USU’s profile, core values, anthem and song, symbols and tagline, and available services and facilities. Students were also introduced to the Fasilkom-TI laboratories and taken on a campus tour to familiarize themselves with the faculty's environment and facilities.

The third day began with student registration and PKKMB attribute checks, followed by a morning exercise session, preparation, and performance of yells. It continued with an introduction to Student Activity Units (UKMs) at USU, student talent showcases, project exhibitions, certificate distribution, and the closing ceremony of PKKMB 2024.

Overall, the PKKMB 2024 at Fasilkom-TI was a resounding success, offering a range of beneficial activities for new students. With the theme “Coding Your Dreams: Weave Your Future,” the event not only provided insights into academics and campus life but also fostered national spirit, environmental awareness, and positive character development. Through various presentations and interactive sessions, new students are expected to embark on their academic journey with solid knowledge and high enthusiasm. Fasilkom-TI remains committed to supporting students in achieving their best potential and creating a campus environment that fosters growth and success.

> News > Fasilkom-TI Conducts Field Assessment for Accreditation of S1 Information Technology Program

Fasilkom-TI Conducts Field Assessment for Accreditation of S1 Information Technology Program

Thumbnail Fasilkom-TI Conducts Field Assessment for Accreditation of S1 Information Technology Program

Fasilkom-TI USU conducted a field assessment for the accreditation of the S1 Information Technology program by LAM INFOKOM, involving visits, criteria discussions, and interviews.

The Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology (Fasilkom-TI) at (USU) conducted a field assessment by the Independent Accreditation Institute for Informatics and Computer Science (LAM INFOKOM) for the S1 Information Technology program on Friday, March 8, 2024, at Fasilkom-TI USU. This activity was carried out as part of the accreditation process for the S1 Information Technology program at USU.

The assessment was attended by the LAM INFOKOM assessment team, including Prof. Dr. Eri Prasetyo, S.SI., M.M.S.I., from Universitas Gunadarma, and Dr. Nur Rokhman, S.Si., M.Kom., from Universitas Gadjah Mada. The event began with introductions and the signing of the Field Assessment statement. It continued with visits to classrooms, faculty offices, laboratories, and IT facilities.

The activities proceeded with discussions on criteria A, B, C1-C9, and D conducted by the assessment team, program leaders, research institutions, the Head of the Program Management Unit (UPPS), student affairs, financial department, and facilities management. Subsequently, interviews were conducted with faculty and educational staff by the assessment team. Additionally, interviews with students, alumni, and graduates' users were conducted to observe student interactions as subjects of the university.

The event concluded with the submission of the draft field assessment report to the UPPS leadership for review, signing of the field assessment report, and the delivery of feedback and developmental recommendations for Information Technology.

> News > Fasilkom-TI Conducts International Student Mobility Program with School of Computing UUM

Fasilkom-TI Conducts International Student Mobility Program with School of Computing UUM

Thumbnail Fasilkom-TI Conducts International Student Mobility Program with School of Computing UUM

The Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology (Fasilkom-TI) of the (USU) has conducted an International Student Mobility Program with the School of Computing Universiti Utara Malaysia (UUM) on Monday, September 18, 2023 in the Seminar Room Building C Fasilkom-TI.

The Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology (Fasilkom-TI) of the (USU) has conducted an International Student Mobility Program with the School of Computing Universiti Utara Malaysia (UUM) on Monday, September 18, 2023 in the Seminar Room Building C Fasilkom-TI.

The activity began with the opening by the Master Ceremony (MC), singing the Indonesia Raya song, reading prayers, remarks from the Deputy Dean of UUM representative Prof. Madya Ts. Dr. Mohamad Fadli Zolkipli, and remarks from the Dean of Fasilkom-TI Dr. Maya Silvi Lidya, B.Sc, M.Sc.

This program consists of several activities that support cooperation with UUM, namely the Joint Research Colloquium for S2 / S3 students and lecturers from UUM and USU in the Seminar Room Building C and D Fasilkom-TI. Furthermore, a public lecture with the material Through the HCI-UX Lenses: Designing for Persons with Disabilities presented by Prof. Madya Dr. Husniza binti Husni in the Seminar Room Building E.

In the public lecture, it was explained that there is a difference between universal design and inclusive design. Universal design is a design that is only made for all users, while inclusive design is a design that is customized and specific to a user. In designing applications, there are processes or stages that must be carried out, namely design thinking. Design thinking consists of five processes, namely, empathize, define, ideate, prototype, and test.

Then, the activity continued with ishoma and eating together and ended with the handover of souvenirs from Fasilkom-TI to UUM and a group photo in the Seminar Room Building E Fasilkom-TI.

> News > Fasilkom-TI Conducts Practical Lecture on Virtual Systems: Practical Guide to Cloud Virtualization, IaC, and Security

Fasilkom-TI Conducts Practical Lecture on Virtual Systems: Practical Guide to Cloud Virtualization, IaC, and Security

Thumbnail Fasilkom-TI Conducts Practical Lecture on Virtual Systems: Practical Guide to Cloud Virtualization, IaC, and Security

The Fasilkom-TI USU held a lecture on cloud virtualization, IaC, and security on June 6, 2024, featuring Ryan Hamonangan, followed by a Q&A session.

The Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology (Fasilkom-TI) of (USU) has held a practitioner lecture in the field of virtual systems with the title "Practical Guide to Cloud Virtualization, IaC, and Security". This practitioner lecture was held on Thursday, June 6, 2024 at the Digital Learning Center Building (DLCB) 8th Floor, .

This activity was moderated by Information Technology Lecturer, Seniman, S.Kom, M.Kom., followed by remarks from the Head of the Information Technology Study Program, Dedy Arisandi, S.T, M.Kom., and singing the Indonesia Raya song. The speaker of this practitioner lecture was Ryan Hamonangan, S.Kom, M.T., a Software Architect from Astra International Tbk Olx Indonesia.

In the presentation, Ryan explained about cloud computing, such as cloud computing service providers that are widely used by people, how it works and the benefits of using cloud computing. In addition, Ryan also invited students to create a database design for the USU cafe website. Furthermore, certificates from Fasilkom-TI were given to the speakers.

At the end of the session, questions and answers were opened to the speakers. Some Fasilkom-TI students asked the speakers about the use of databases, how a system is exposed to data leaks and blockchain. From this question and answer session, it shows that Fasilkom-TI students are very enthusiastic about this practitioner lecture.

> News > Fasilkom-TI Dean's Award 2024

Fasilkom-TI Dean's Award 2024 Published At

Thumbnail Fasilkom-TI Dean's Award 2024 Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology (FasilkomTI) USU held the Dean's List Award 2024 to appreciate the achievements of students in local, national, and international competitions.

Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology (FasilkomTI) USU Hosts Dean's List Award 2024 to Recognize Outstanding Students

On June 19, 2024, the Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology (FasilkomTI) at (USU) organized the Dean's List Award event. The purpose of this event was to honor and appreciate students who have achieved remarkable success at both national and international levels.

The event was graced by the presence of the Dean of FasilkomTI, Dr. Maya Silvi Lydia B.Sc., M.Sc., and Vice Dean I, Dr. Mohammad Andri Budiman S.T., M.Comp.Sc., M.E.M., marking a significant moment for students who have excelled in various prestigious competitions.

Here is the detailed list of FasilkomTI USU students who received awards at the Dean's List Award 2024:

- Third Winner, "The Web Development Solution Challenge" by Google Developer Student Club (GDSC) USU.

- Third Winner, "The Web Development Solution Challenge" by GDSC USU.

- Top 20 Business Ideas in , "Boosting Startup Capacity & Build Stronger Entrepreneur in University Ecosystem" by KEMENKOP-UKM and USU.

- 2nd Place (Barebow 20m Men), "ATC CUP 2023" by UKM Panahan USU ATC.

> News > Fasilkom-TI Explores Collaboration with National Startups

Fasilkom-TI Explores Collaboration with National Startups Published At

Thumbnail Fasilkom-TI Explores Collaboration with National Startups

Fasilkom-TI USU explored collaborations with startups at AIIS 2023 and met APNIC and Alibaba Cloud, aiming to enhance education, research, and resources.

The Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology (Fasilkom-TI) at (USU) explored collaboration with national startup companies over two days from August 10-11, 2023. This initiative aimed to establish new partnerships with high-quality industries to support the development of education, research, and resources within Fasilkom-TI.

On the first day, Fasilkom-TI attended the Artificial Intelligence Innovation Summit (AIIS) 2023 at Jakarta International Expo. Organized by KORIKA (Collaboration for Artificial Intelligence Research and Innovation) and CTIS (Center for Technology & Innovation Studies), the event featured a dynamic conference and immersive exhibition highlighting the vast potential of artificial intelligence (AI) across various industries. AIIS 2023 emphasized four main missions: leveraging collaboration for national progress, empowering innovative thinking with character and competence, building data ecosystems and infrastructure, and promoting national advancement while upholding ethics for a harmonious digital future.

On the second day, Fasilkom-TI met with Wita Laksono, Senior Internet Resources Analyst at APNIC (Asia-Pacific Network Information Center), to discuss potential collaboration opportunities between Fasilkom-TI and APNIC. APNIC is a Regional Internet Registry (RIR) serving the Asia-Pacific region, covering 56 countries in Asia and Oceania, and is divided into four sub-regions: South, Southeast, East, and Oceania.

Fasilkom-TI then visited Alibaba Cloud, a division of Alibaba Group specializing in cloud computing. Alibaba Cloud Academy offers over 300 online and offline training sessions to enhance the cloud computing skills of its business partners, including Resellers, Service Partners, and Technology Partners. The Academy also provides professional certification and training to deepen partners’ knowledge of Alibaba Cloud’s products. After discussing potential collaborations, Fasilkom-TI toured Alibaba Cloud’s office, observed the company’s work environment, and exchanged souvenirs with Alibaba Cloud representatives.

The activities aim to foster mutually beneficial collaborations between Fasilkom-TI and industry partners, enhance the quality of education, research, and human resources, and achieve the university's performance indicators (IKU).

> News > Fasilkom-TI Representative Team Wins Fordigi Hackathon Challenge 2023 Competition

Fasilkom-TI Representative Team Wins Fordigi Hackathon Challenge 2023 Competition

Thumbnail Fasilkom-TI Representative Team Wins Fordigi Hackathon Challenge 2023 Competition

A total of three teams from the Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology (Fasilkom-TI) of the (USU) won the Fordigi Hackathon Challenge 2023 competition held on Tuesday, August 29, 2023 at the USU Student Center.

A total of three teams from the Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology (Fasilkom-TI) of the (USU) won the Fordigi Hackathon Challenge 2023 competition held on Tuesday, August 29, 2023 at the USU Student Center.

Fordigi Goes to Campus was organized by Jasa Raharja and the Digital Forum (Fordigi) of State-Owned Enterprises (BUMN). USU became the sixth university visited by this activity. The Fordigi Goes to Campus City Chapter VI-Medan activity raised the theme "The future of digital mortgage." Some of the series of activities are hybrid seminars, the Fordigi Hackathon Challenge competition, the Deep Racer League competition, and the Call for Paper on Personal Data Protection Law (PDP).

Fordigi, previously known as Forti BUMN (BUMN Information Technology Forum), is a partner of the Ministry of BUMN in developing a global standard digital ecosystem and talent in BUMN. The Ministry of SOEs supports Fordigi in coordinating and organizing the SOE Digital Talent Program.

Fordigi Hackathon Challenge is a competition that aims to attract digital talents among students who can become problem solvers for issues in their respective regions. The five priority programs that the Mayor of Medan has set are health, infrastructure management, flood management and cleanliness, revamping heritage areas, and empowering MSMEs.

The first winner of the Fordigi Hackathon Challenge was won by the Tanimed Team, one of whose members is a student of Fasilkom-TI, Deza Banjarnahor from Information Technology 2021. The Tanimed team brought a solution to solve the problem of one of the five priority programs of the city of Medan, namely the health program in the focus area of stunting. The Tanimed team designed the solution in a high-fidelity prototype called Endstunting. The main feature of Endstunting is tracking and monitoring children's growth and development using artificial intelligence. In the next stage, Tanimed Team will be the representative of City Chapter Medan to participate in the National Fordigi Hackathon Final which will be held in Jakarta.

The Parentify Team, with two of its three members being Fasilkom-TI students Deza Banjarnahor and Ridopandi Sinaga from Information Technology 2021, won 3rd place in the Fordigi Hackathon Challenge. The Parentify team brought a solution about parenting by targeting solutions to the problems of the city of Medan in the first program, namely health, and the fourth program, namely cleanliness. The Parentify team produces high-fidelity prototype products intended to be a learning application designed by applying artificial intelligence by adjusting the user's level of understanding of parenting.

The Fordigi Hackathon Challenge Favorite Champion was won by the Techy Wizards Team led by Andhika Mandalanta Saragih and two members, Rani Widya Astuti and Pieter Tanoto from Computer Science 2021. The Techy Wizards team presented an application design by supporting the five priority programs of Medan City in the first program, namely health and the fourth program, namely cleanliness. The application design was made with the aim to help people find the nearest waste bank online and provide education to the people of Medan City on how to manage waste properly.

> News > Fasilkom-TI Scolar Team Goes to the 36th PIMNAS

Fasilkom-TI Scolar Team Goes to the 36th PIMNAS Published At

Thumbnail Fasilkom-TI Scolar Team Goes to the 36th PIMNAS The Scolar Team from the Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology (Fasilkom-TI), (USU) has passed to the final stage of the Student Creativity Week (PKM), namely participating in the National Student Science Week (PIMNAS). The 36th PIMNAS will be held at Padjadjaran University, Bandung on November 26 - December 1, 2023.

The Scolar Team from the Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology (Fasilkom-TI), (USU) has passed to the final stage of the Student Creativity Week (PKM), namely participating in the National Student Science Week (PIMNAS). The 36th PIMNAS will be held at Padjadjaran University, Bandung on November 26 - December 1, 2023.

The Scolar team is chaired by Mhd Afifan Aly Rahman Saragih with members Ridha Arrahmi, M.D.Arbani Asfi Dalimunthe who is a 2020 Information Technology student, Annisa Cahyani a 2022 Information Technology student, and Jernih a 2020 Accounting student. This team was accompanied by Fasilkom-TI lecturers, namely, Dewi Sartika Ginting, S.Kom., M.Kom,.

Smart Comic Learning (Scolar) is an educational media for preventing bullying in children in the form of comics based on Augmented Reality. The Scolar team has published the Scolar volume 1 comic with the title Mission of Alisa. The comic tells the adventures of Alisa and her friends to eradicate bullying in their school. Readers can enjoy three-dimensional (3D) animation of characters in several comic scenes through the Scolar application that has been integrated with Augmented Reality technology. The Scolar app can be downloaded through PlayStore.

In the future, they are trying hard to get the 36th PIMNAS medal by maximizing product marketing by expanding the market to major cities in Indonesia outside, working with publishers and bookstores in Indonesia, especially in Medan City, and adding comic series with different age levels. Currently, Mission of Alisa comics are ready to be ordered by readers. Purchases can be made via Instagram, WhatsApp, or Shopee Komik.Scolar.

> News > Fasilkom-TI Wins Multiple Awards at USU Awarding Night

Fasilkom-TI Wins Multiple Awards at USU Awarding Night Published At

Thumbnail Fasilkom-TI Wins Multiple Awards at USU Awarding Night

Fasilkom-TI at USU won multiple awards at the USU Awarding Night, awarding academic achievements and contributions from students, alumni, and stakeholders.

The Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology (Fasilkom-TI) at (USU) received several awards at the USU Awarding Night held at the USU Auditorium on Friday, December 15, 2023. The USU Awarding Night is an awards ceremony aimed at recognizing and appreciating the academic community, accredited study programs, notable figures, and educational institutions at USU that have contributed to uplifting the university's name through their achievements, as well as students who have excelled in national and international competitions.

Fasilkom-TI brought home several awards, including achieving a 100% reporting data percentage for USU during the PDDIKTI reporting period for the even semester of the 2022/2023 academic year and ranking second in the category of the highest employer reputation. Fasilkom-TI students also received several awards, including the national achievement category awarded to M. Ariyo Syahraza, a 2021 student of Information Technology, as a recipient of funding from the Student Entrepreneurship Development Program (P2MW), and Mhd. Afifan Aly R. Saragih, a 2020 student of Information Technology, won a silver medal at the 2023 National Student Scientific Week (PIMNAS) in the poster category. Farhan Doli Fadhiil Siagian, a 2020 Computer Science student, won the national third place at the Youth Innovation event by cias.co and Rumah Kepemimpinan. Donny Adithya, a 2021 student of Information Technology, was awarded the national second place for his innovation in community service products outside of PIMNAS. Deza Banjarnahor, a 2021 student of Information Technology, won the regional category at the Fordigi Hackathon Challenge.

USU Rector Dr. Muryanto Amin S.Sos., M.Si., expressed his appreciation to all academic community members who have achieved outstanding results and made significant contributions to USU. This achievement has positioned USU as a university with great potential to enter the top 500 of the QS World University Rankings.

The event also featured various entertainment segments showcasing internal, local, and national artists. The USU Rector recognized the academic community and several alumni, partners, and related stakeholders, including the Mayor of Medan, Bobby Nasution, who received an award as an education advocate.

> News > Field Assessment of Accreditation of Master of Data Science and Artificial Intelligence Study Program

Field Assessment of Accreditation of Master of Data Science and Artificial Intelligence Study Program

Thumbnail Field Assessment of Accreditation of Master of Data Science and Artificial Intelligence Study Program

Fasilkom-TI USU carried out a field assessment of the accreditation of the Master of Data Science and Artificial Intelligence Study Program by LAM INFOKOM on March 20-21, 2023, involving a comprehensive evaluation and interviews.

Medan, Fasilkom-TI - The Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology (Fasilkom-TI) of (USU) conducted an accreditation field assessment of the Master of Data Science and Artificial Intelligence Study Program on Monday and Tuesday, March 20-21, 2023 in the Seminar Room of Building E of Fasilkom-TI.

The accreditation field assessment was carried out by the Informatics and Computer Self-Accreditation Institute (LAM INFOKOM). The activity was opened by the Master of Ceremony (MC), opening remarks by the Dean of Fasilkom-TI Dr. Maya Silvi Lydia, B.Sc., M.Sc., opening remarks by USU Vice Chancellor 3 Dr. Poppy Anjelisa Zaitun Hasibuan.., S.Si, M.Si., Apt., and remarks by representatives of the LAM-INFOKOM assessor team Ir. Wahyu Chess Wibowo, M.Sc., Ph.D., and Dr. Ir. R. Rizal Isnanto, S.T., M.M., M.T., IPU, ASEAN Eng.

In his speech, Dr. Ir. R. Rizal Isnanto, S.T., M.M., M.T., IPU, ASEAN Eng. said that LAM-INFOKOM uses five processes in assessing a study program, namely, establishment, implementation, evaluation, control, and improvement. He also added that with this accreditation field assessment, both from Fasilkom-TI and LAM-INFOKOM learn together in improving the quality of study programs. The next activity was the signing of the minutes of the accreditation field assessment, visiting classrooms, lecturer rooms, laboratories, and infrastructure facilities and discussing criteria A, B, C1-C9, D, and E.

On the second day, the activity continued by interviewing lecturers, education staff, students, alumni, and graduate users. Furthermore, the submission of the draft minutes of the field assessment to the head of the Study Program Management Unit (UPPS) for review and ended with the signing of the minutes of the field assessment and the delivery of feedback and coaching suggestions.

> News > Field Assessment of Computer Science S3 Study Program Accreditation

Field Assessment of Computer Science S3 Study Program Accreditation

Thumbnail Field Assessment of Computer Science S3 Study Program Accreditation

Fasilkom-TI USU held an accreditation assessment of S3 Computer Science by LAM INFOKOM on November 18-19, 2022, involving facility visits and interviews.

Medan, Humas Fasilkom-TI - The Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology (Fasilkom-TI) of (USU) conducted a field assessment of the accreditation of the S3 Computer Science Study Program on November 18-19, 2022 at the Science Data Seminar Building and Artificial Intelligence Fasilkom-TI.

The accreditation field assessment was carried out by the Informatics and Computer Self-Accreditation Institute (LAM INFOKOM). The activity was opened by the Master Ceremony (MC), followed by remarks from Vice Rector IV Prof. Dr. Opim Salim Sitompul, M.Sc, Dean of Fasilkom-TI Dr. Maya Silvi Lydia, B.Sc., M.Sc, and the LAM INFOKOM assessor team, Agus Harjoko, Ph.D and Prof. Dr. Kusrini, M.Kom.

In her speech, Prof. Dr. Kusrini, M.Kom, said that the LAM INFOKOM assessment is based on the standards set by the faculty. "Unlike the BAN-PT assessment, after that we focus on what has been achieved and what will be done afterwards," she said. After that, the activity continued by visiting classrooms, lecturer rooms, laboratories, and infrastructure facilities, then discussing criteria A, B, C1-C9, D, and E.

On the second day, the activity continued by interviewing lecturers, education staff, students, alumni, and graduate users. Furthermore, the submission of the draft minutes of the field assessment to the head of the Study Program Management Unit (UPPS) for review and ended with the signing of the minutes of the field assessment and the delivery of feedback and coaching suggestions.

> News > Improving Education Quality, Master’s Program in Informatics Engineering of USU Participates in OBE-Based Curriculum Technical Guidance with APTIKOM North Sumatra

Improving Education Quality, Master’s Program in Informatics Engineering of USU Participates in OBE-Based Curriculum Technical Guidance with APTIKOM North Sumatra

Christoffel Daniel Yesaya Tambunan

Thumbnail Improving Education Quality, Master’s Program in Informatics Engineering of USU Participates in OBE-Based Curriculum Technical Guidance with APTIKOM North Sumatra

Medan, MTIF Public Relations – The Master’s Program in Informatics Engineering (MTIF) of (USU) participated in the technical guidance (Bimtek) for the development of an Outcome-Based Education (OBE) curriculum for the field of Informatics and Computer Science, held on Friday to Saturday (February 17–18) at Hotel Putra Mulia Medan. The activity was organized by the Indonesian Association of Higher Education in Informatics and Computing (APTIKOM) North Sumatra Region in collaboration with STMIK Kaputama as the host, and several universities and organizations as co-hosts, including IOCSScience, UMI, STIKOM Tunas Bangsa, and ITB Indonesia.

This technical guidance event was attended by 10 representatives from the Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology (Fasilkom-TI) of , representing five study programs in Informatics and Computer Science: Undergraduate Program in Computer Science, Undergraduate Program in Information Technology, Master’s Program in Informatics Engineering, Master’s Program in Data Science and Artificial Intelligence, and Doctoral Program in Computer Science. In addition, 87 other participants from 33 public and private universities in the North Sumatra Region were also present.

The materials for the technical guidance were presented clearly and systematically by Prihandoko, M.IT., Ph.D., the Chair of the APTIKOM Study Program Forum, complete with examples that were easy for participants to understand. After the material presentation, participants were asked to directly practice drafting an Informatics curriculum, accompanied by technical guidance facilitators Dr. Erwin Budi Setiawan, S.Si., M.T., and Dr. Iman Marzuki Shofi, S.Si., M.T. This OBE curriculum drafting practice, which took place on the first day until 9:00 p.m. WIB, was followed on the second day by a presentation session on the progress of the OBE-based curriculum development. Three participant representatives presented their curriculum drafts: , Universitas Methodist Indonesia, and Universitas Medan Area.

Separately interviewed by MTIF Public Relations, the Secretary of the MTIF USU Study Program, Indra Aulia, S.TI., M.Kom., who fully participated from the first to the second day, expressed his deep appreciation to APTIKOM North Sumatra Region for facilitating this activity and extended gratitude to all parties who contributed to its success. He also expressed hope that implementing the OBE curriculum would significantly improve master’s-level education by producing graduates who possess strong hard skills and outstanding soft skills at both national and international levels.

> News > Outstanding Achievement of Fasilkom-TI USU at GEMASTIK 2024

Outstanding Achievement of Fasilkom-TI USU at GEMASTIK 2024 Published At

Thumbnail Outstanding Achievement of Fasilkom-TI USU at GEMASTIK 2024

Fasilkom-TI USU teams advanced to the GEMASTIK 2024 finals, showcasing innovative ideas and competitive skills in ICT, guided by experienced lecturers.

The Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology (Fasilkom-TI) at (USU) has once again made a remarkable achievement at the national level. Several student teams have successfully advanced to the final round of the National Student Exhibition in Information and Communication Technology (GEMASTIK) 2024, which will be held at Universitas Negeri Semarang.

GEMASTIK is an annual competition organized by the Indonesian Talent Development Center, National Achievement Center, Ministry of Education, Culture, Research, and Technology. The main goal of this competition is to enhance students' competencies in Information and Communication Technology (ICT), enabling them to become agents of change in the development and utilization of ICT, both during their studies and after graduation.

USU Fasilkom-TI Delegation Teams Advancing to the Finals

Below is the list of Fasilkom-TI USU teams that have made it to the final round:

1. Team Brainiacs - Supervisor: Dr. T. Henny Febriana, S.Kom., M.Kom - Leader: Gideon Togap Hata Oloan Manurung (Information Technology 2021)

- Adelweys Margaretha Sijabat (Information Technology 2021) - Aurelia Priscilia Simamora (Information Technology 2021)

2. Team OrangSigma - Supervisor: Rossy Nurhasanah, S.Kom., M.Kom - Leader: Anugrah Syahputra Sibarani (Computer Science 2023) - Members:

- Muhammad Dzakwan Attaqiy (Computer Science 2023) - Muhammad Syukron Jazila (Computer Science 2023)

3. Team WiseWaste - Supervisor: Dewi Sartika Br Ginting, S.Kom., M.Kom - Leader: R. Khairu Wahyutama (Information Technology 2022) - Members:

- Grant Gabriel Tambunan (Information Technology 2022) - Fathurrahman (Information Technology 2022)

4. Team CariPengalaman - Supervisor: Dr. T. Henny Febriana, S.Kom., M.Kom - Leader: Gabryelle Ninna Deffanya Siahaan (Information Technology 2021)

- Putrija Br. Malau (Information Technology 2021) - Gery Jonathan Manurung (Information Technology 2021)

The success of these teams demonstrates that Fasilkom-TI USU students possess competitive abilities and are ready to compete at the national level in the field of technology. With guidance from highly competent lecturers, they are able to develop innovative ideas that are relevant to the progress of ICT in Indonesia.

Congratulations to all Fasilkom-TI USU teams who have advanced to the finals. May this success inspire them to continue excelling and making meaningful contributions to the development of technology in Indonesia.
