> News > Perception Equalization Bootcamp for USU Facilkom-TI Laboratory Assistants

Perception Equalization Bootcamp for USU Facilkom-TI Laboratory Assistants

Thumbnail Perception Equalization Bootcamp for USU Facilkom-TI Laboratory Assistants

Fasilkom-TI USU held a bootcamp for lab assistants to equalize the perception of Data Engineering and UI/UX courses, with presenters from Mamikos and Bank Sinarmas.

Medan, USU - The Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology, (Fasilkom-TI USU) held a Perception Equalization Bootcamp for all teaching laboratory assistants in the field of Networking and Programming. This event specifically discussed courses related to Data Engineering and Project Management in the UI/UX field.

This event aims to identify the relationship between ITLG (Introduction to Technology and Logic Gates) and IKLC (Introduction to Knowledge and Logic Computing) courses related to Data Engineering and UI/UX. With this, it is expected that the laboratory assistants can find similarities and differences between the two courses. In addition, this event also aims to establish clear boundaries between ITLG and IKLC and encourage cooperation in the preparation of syllabi for both courses.

1. Dani Setiawan, S.Kom., a Senior Data Engineer at Mamikos.com.

2. Richard Valent Petrus Silalahi, S.Kom., Product Manager Department Head at PT Bank Sinarmas Tbk.

The event began with opening remarks from the Dean of USU's Facilkom-TI, Dr. Maya Silvi Lydia B.Sc., M.Sc. She expressed her hope that this bootcamp can provide new insights for laboratory assistants in understanding the relationship between Data Engineering and UI/UX courses.

Furthermore, Mrs. Hayatunnufus S.Kom., M.Cs., as the Head of the Network Lab, gave a speech and appreciated the participants who participated in this event. The Head of Programming Lab, Mr. Herriyance S.T., M.Kom., also delivered his enthusiastic speech.

The event then continued with a group photo session as a sign of togetherness and cohesiveness.

Dani Setiawan, S.Kom., presented material about Data Engineering. He explained the basic concepts of Data Engineering, its role in industry, and how laboratory assistants can integrate this knowledge into the courses they teach.

After that, Richard Valent Petrus Silalahi, S.Kom., presented material about Project Management in the UI/UX field. He discussed the importance of project management in UI/UX development and provided practical tips for laboratory assistants in managing projects in this field.

As an interlude, the event also presented interactive and fun minigames to break the ice and strengthen relationships between participants.

The highlight of the event was a perception-equalizing discussion by ITLG and IKLC on courses in Data Engineering and UI/UX. This discussion aimed to establish clear boundaries between ITLG and IKLC and facilitate collaboration in creating the course syllabus.

With this bootcamp, it is expected that the laboratory assistants of Fasilkom-TI USU can work more effectively and efficiently in teaching, and be able to develop a better syllabus that is relevant to industry needs.

> News > Scolar Team Receives Silver Medal at The 36th PIMNAS

Scolar Team Receives Silver Medal at The 36th PIMNAS Published At

Thumbnail Scolar Team Receives Silver Medal at The 36th PIMNAS

The Augmented Reality-based Smart Comic Learning (Scolar) team from the Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology (Fasilkom-TI) brought a silver medal in the poster category competition at the 36th National Scientific Week (PIMNAS) held on November 27-30, 2023 at Padjadjaran University, Bandung.

The Augmented Reality-based Smart Comic Learning (Scolar) team from the Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology (Fasilkom-TI) brought a silver medal in the poster category competition at the 36th National Scientific Week (PIMNAS) held on November 27-30, 2023 at Padjadjaran University, Bandung.

The Scolar Team participated in two categories of competition, namely presentations and posters. The poster made by the Scolar Team discusses the background and purpose of the presence of Scolar as bullying prevention education, discusses the implementation of Student Creativity Week - Entrepreneurship (PKM-K) activities that have been carried out from June - November 2023, and the advantages of the innovative products made.

Before achieving this victory, the Scolar Team has gone through many things such as marketing, sales charts, analysis, finance, and business sustainability. The advantages of the innovative products they made were very promising, namely products in the form of colorful comics, storylines wrapped in mission completion, AR-based applications with 3D characters and voice over, interactive games, mini quizzes, and bullying articles.

The plan for the next stage of the product that has been made is to add a series of comic publications and conduct promotions in 128 elementary schools (SD) in Binjai city according to the results of the hearing with the Binjai city Education Office that has been carried out. As for further plans, the Scolar Team wants to expand the market expansion and establish a business entity.

The Scolar Team explained that PIMNAS is an impactful event for Indonesian students. Besides being able to make the university proud, participating in PIMNAS can recognize and network with universities outside Sumatra. They also added, for students who wish to participate in PIMNAS, they can prepare themselves from now on and start forming teams and innovation ideas.

> News > Successful Focus Group Discussion on AI Startups at the Undergraduate Program in Information Technology, Fasilkom-TI, USU, in Collaboration with Doku and Kata.ai

Successful Focus Group Discussion on AI Startups at the Undergraduate Program in Information Technology, Fasilkom-TI, USU, in Collaboration with Doku and Kata.ai

Thumbnail Successful Focus Group Discussion on AI Startups at the Undergraduate Program in Information Technology, Fasilkom-TI, USU, in Collaboration with Doku and Kata.ai

The FGD on AI at the Undergraduate Program in Information Technology, USU, successfully provided insights on AI startups and innovation opportunities in the digital era, in collaboration with Doku and Kata.ai.

The Undergraduates Program in Information Technology at the Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology (Fasilkom-TI) at (USU) successfully held a Focus Group Discussion (FGD) on Artificial Intelligence (AI) in collaboration with Doku and Kata.ai on Tuesday, September 17, in the Seminar Room of Building E, Fasilkom-TI.

The event began with participant registration, an opening and brief explanation of the agenda by the moderator, the singing of the national anthem "Indonesia Raya," welcoming remarks from the Head of the Undergraduates Program in Information Technology, Dedy Arisandi, S.T., M.Kom., and a group photo with faculty, speakers, and Information Technology students.

The event proceeded with Session 1, which featured a presentation titled “Designing a Business Model Canvas for Digital AI Startups” by Doku's Product Manager, Ricky Hilmi Sudrajad. During his presentation, he discussed the key role of AI in digital transformation, the implementation of Generative AI (GenAI) for digital AI startups, an introduction to the business model canvas, and how to create a business model canvas for digital AI startups. This session was followed by a Q&A segment with Information Technology students. To conclude Session 1, there was an interactive discussion between students and the speaker on creating a business model canvas for designing a digital AI startup.

Session 2 featured a presentation titled “Building the Future of Business With Artificial Intelligence” by the Commercial Director of Kata.ai, Wisnu D. Yudha. The presentation began with a brief introduction to Kata.ai, discussed the rapidly evolving field of Generative AI, competition in the AI space, strategies for building AI startups, and a strategic framework for AI startups. Overall, this presentation provided critical insights into the importance of innovation in generative AI technology and the significant opportunities for startups to thrive in an ever-changing business landscape. Session 2 also included a Q&A segment with Information Technology students, concluding with an interactive discussion on drafting a business proposal.

The FGD concluded with a summary from the moderator. Participants, especially the Information Technology students, expressed that the insights provided by both speakers were immensely helpful, particularly regarding the opportunities and challenges of building AI startups in the digital era. It is hoped that this event will motivate students to delve deeper into the world of AI and prepare themselves to face the rapidly evolving technological revolution. Additionally, this initiative is expected to mark the beginning of more intensive collaboration between Fasilkom-TI, the industry, and the AI startup ecosystem in the future.

> News > The Rector's Working Visit to Work Units at Fasilkom-TI

The Rector's Working Visit to Work Units at Fasilkom-TI Published At

Thumbnail The Rector's Working Visit to Work Units at Fasilkom-TI

The Rector's visit to Fasilkom-TI aims to monitor and strengthen the performance and activities of work units.

Working Visit of the Rector to work units at the Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology (Fasilkom-TI) (USU), known as "Rektor Menyapa" or Rektor's Greetings, was successfully conducted on Tuesday, January 10, 2023, in the Seminar Room of Building D at Fasilkom-TI.

The event was attended by Dr. Muryanto Amin, S.Sos., M.Si., the Rector of USU; Prof. Dr. Opim Salim Sitompul, M.Sc., Vice Rector IV; Dr. Maya Silvi Lydia, M.Sc., the Dean of Fasilkom-TI; Dr. Mohammad Andri Budiman, S.T., M.Comp.Sc., M.E.M., Vice Dean I; Sarah Purnamawati ST., M.Sc., Vice Dean II; and various lecturers from Fasilkom-TI.

In his opening remarks, the Rector explained that the purpose of this activity is to evaluate programs that were implemented in 2022 and to discuss and align perceptions so that new programs in this year can run smoothly. Furthermore, main issues to be addressed this year include learning methods, learning process improvement curriculum quality facilities software and hardware quality.

In addition to that,in 2023 USU will implement a new program called International Class which aims to transform classrooms into spaces that can fulfill various indicators set by the university. The International Class program will focus on aspects such as education ethics innovation research Student Creativity Week (Pekan Kreativitas Mahasiswa) and collaboration with practitioner lecturers or foreign lecturers.This event also serves as a platform for discussion and Q&A session between academic community members from Fasilkom-TI with the Rector.

Overall,the visit provided an opportunity for fruitful discussions which will contribute to further development and improvement in various areas at Fasilkom-TI under USU's guidance.

Fasilkom-TITerima Fasilitas CSR Wifi Corner dari PT Pertamina Gas Negara

Class Visit from SMAS Sukma Bangsa Lhokseumawe to Fasilkom-TI USU

> News > Three Teams from Fasilkom-TI Qualify for PIMNAS 37 in 2024

Three Teams from Fasilkom-TI Qualify for PIMNAS 37 in 2024 Published At

Thumbnail Three Teams from Fasilkom-TI Qualify for PIMNAS 37 in 2024

Three Fasilkom-TI USU teams qualified for PIMNAS 37, held at Airlangga University from October 14-19, 2024, showcasing student innovation and creativity.

Three teams from the Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology (Fasilkom-TI) at the University of North Sumatra (USU) have qualified to participate in the 37th National Scientific Week (PIMNAS) in 2024. PIMNAS 37 will be held at Airlangga University from October 14 to 19, 2024.

The PIMNAS event is part of the evaluation process for student proposal programs known as the Student Creativity Program (PKM) and the assessment of the progress of PKM implementation (PKP2), organized by the Directorate of Learning and Student Affairs - Directorate General of Higher Education, and the Directorate of Vocational Higher Education - Directorate General of Vocational Education.

The teams are as follows: The SkiDoTrack Team in the Community Service PKM scheme, with the research title "Educational Program for Screening and Prevention of Stunting Through Optimization of the SKIDOTrack Application: Smart Kids Development Tracking System for PKK Mothers in Limau Sundai." The SkiDoTrack team members include Dona Lorenza from Computer Science 2021 and Siti Nur Salsabila, Rafi Fauzan Tsany Lubis, Daffa Prawira Akbar, and Tiara Bella Dwiyanti Sitepu from Computer Science 2023, supervised by Computer Science lecturer Dewi Sartika Ginting, S.Kom, M.Kom.

Next is the Elcue Team, participating under the Karsa Cipta PKM scheme with the research title "ElCue: A Video Call Application with Indonesian Sign Language Detection (BISINDO) Based on Computer Vision and Deep Learning to Enhance Inclusive Communication." Team members include Tessa Agitha Irwani Br Barus, Putri Andriyani, Rani Widya Astuti, Angela Siadari, and Heiga Pricilla Br Purba from Computer Science 2021. This team is supervised by Computer Science lecturer Hayatunnufus, S.Kom., M.Cs.

The final team is the Dedel Team in the Community Service PKM scheme, with the research title "Optimization of Maternal and Child Health (KIA): Digitalization of KMS (Health Guide Card) Based on Machine Learning Using DEDEL (Early Detection Electronic)." The Dedel team consists of Rizky Maulana Sembiring and Husein Ibnu Mahmud from Computer Science 2021, along with Rara Maura Hasibuan, Fahia Meutia Mufida, and Davina Athirah from Public Health 2021. This team is supervised by Public Health lecturer Dhani Syahputra Bukti, SKM., MKM.

The success of these three teams from Fasilkom-TI USU demonstrates that student innovation and creativity are continually evolving to address societal challenges through technology and research. With the qualification of these three teams, it is hoped that their contributions at PIMNAS 37 will have a broader positive impact and inspire other students to continue creating and innovating.

> News > Tim Literaku achieved 1st place in The Best Disability Quality of Life Improvement Solution at the Innovillage Awards 2024.

Tim Literaku achieved 1st place in The Best Disability Quality of Life Improvement Solution at the Innovillage Awards 2024.

Thumbnail Tim Literaku achieved 1st place in The Best Disability Quality of Life Improvement Solution at the Innovillage Awards 2024.

Tim Literaku from Fasilkom-TI USU won 1st place at the Innovillage Awards 2024 held at the Auditorium of Damar Building, Telkom University, on Saturday, March 9, 2024. They presented the project "LITERAKU: Voice-based Book Innovation to Improve Literacy for the Visually Impaired at SLB-A Tanjung Morawa."

Team Literaku, representing the Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology (Fasilkom-TI) at (USU), achieved 1st place at the Innovillage Awards 2024 for The Best Disability Quality of Life Improvement Solution. The Innovillage Awards 2024, organized by Telkom University, took place on Saturday, March 9, 2024, at the Auditorium of Damar Building, Telkom University.

The Innovillage Awards is a social project program in collaboration with PT Telkom Indonesia and Telkom University. This year, Innovillage 2024 adopted the theme "Empowering Young Sociopreneurs for National Development" or "Innovative Sociopreneurship for Sustainable Transformation." The implementation of the Innovillage 2024 program aligns with the government's initiative through Merdeka Belajar - Kampus Merdeka (), which has been implemented and adopted in higher education learning systems.

Innovillage 2024 was participated by 2,385 students, 446 accompanying lecturers, and 795 teams from 146 universities across Indonesia. Through the selection of proposal submissions, 163 social projects were chosen to receive implementation funding totaling 2.4 billion IDR.

In this competition, Team Literaku consisted of Dr. Amalia, S.T., M.T. as the supervising lecturer, Farhan Doli Fadhiil Siagian as the team leader, and Andrew Benedictus Jamesie and Ariel Matius Surbakti as team members from the Computer Science undergraduate program, class of 2020. The social project presented by Team Literaku was titled "LITERAKU: Voice-based Book Innovation to Improve Literacy for the Visually Impaired at SLB-A Tanjung Morawa." Following their win, Team Literaku will enter the incubation phase for further development of their social project to ensure sustainable implementation.

Literaku serves as a literacy solution for the visually impaired, supporting educational opportunities for all. Initiated in 2022, Literaku began as a research project under the Student Creativity Program - Karsa Cipta (PKM-KC). Since its initial launch on the Google Play Store, Literaku has undergone several developments and updates.

Fasilkom-TITerima Fasilitas CSR Wifi Corner dari PT Pertamina Gas Negara

> News > Tim Rodent Watch USU Raih Juara di Asia-Pacific Global Health Innovation Hackathon 2025

Tim Rodent Watch USU Raih Juara di Asia-Pacific Global Health Innovation Hackathon 2025

Thumbnail Tim Rodent Watch USU Raih Juara di Asia-Pacific Global Health Innovation Hackathon 2025

USU’s Rodent Watch Team wins Asia-Pacific Health Hackathon 2025 with cross-disciplinary AI innovation to predict and prevent zoonotic diseases on a global scale.

Rodent Watch Team from USU Wins Asia-Pacific Global Health Innovation Hackathon 2025

Medan, January 2025 — (USU) proudly announces that its Rodent Watch Team has won 1st place at the prestigious Asia-Pacific Global Health Innovation Hackathon 2025, hosted by SingHealth.

The team comprises experts from multiple disciplines:

Dr. Sunna Vyatra Hutagalung, MS, Ph.D – Faculty of Medicine, USU

Dr. Anita Zainunah, S.Hut., M.Sc. – Faculty of Forestry, USU

Dr. Erna Budhiarti Nababan, M.IT – Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology, USU

Drh. Rita Rosmala Dewi, M.Si., Ph.D – Faculty of Animal Husbandry, Universitas Teuku Umar

Their winning project leverages artificial intelligence (AI) to help understand, predict, and reduce the impact of zoonotic diseases. The cross-disciplinary collaboration and innovative approach led them to outshine teams from across the Asia-Pacific region. A special highlight goes to Dr. Erna Budhiarti Nababan for her exceptional contribution.

This victory not only elevates USU’s global reputation but also serves as a strong inspiration for the younger generation to innovate in tackling global health challenges.

> Research > Generating Textual Representation of Healthy Food Menus for Diabetics Through Chatbot Services

Generating Textual Representation of Healthy Food Menus for Diabetics Through Chatbot Services

Thumbnail Generating Textual Representation of Healthy Food Menus for Diabetics Through Chatbot Services

Diabetes has been considered a big problem in the Indonesian health world with an average prevalence of diabetes in Indonesia reaching 6.2% with more than 10 million people suffering from diabetes. To overcome the number of diabetics in Indonesia, guidelines were developed to prevent and manage diabetes.

Diabetes has been considered a big problem in the Indonesian health world with an average prevalence of diabetes in Indonesia reaching 6.2% with more than 10 million people suffering from diabetes. > Research > Virtual Tour of Tjong A Fie Mansion with Gamification as A Medium for History Learning

Virtual Tour of Tjong A Fie Mansion with Gamification as A Medium for History Learning

Thumbnail Virtual Tour of Tjong A Fie Mansion with Gamification as A Medium for History Learning

In this research, VR technology is used for digital preservation and conservation of one of the Medan historical heritages, Tjong A Fie Mansion

The rapid development of technology at the present time has resulted decreasing in the national community’s concern for the historical and cultural heritage that exists in Indonesia. This is also because of the publication media and the methods of historical introduction that are less attractive and interactive. Nowadays, visualization and simulation technology through Virtual Reality (VR) has developed greatly that VR is widely used and applied in various science field. So far, many historical buildings reconstruction that have been made into 2D format as well as 360° video views. However, in terms of visualization details and immersive experiences, user interactions in VR environment are limited. In this research, VR technology is used for digital preservation and conservation of one of the Medan historical heritages, Tjong A Fie Mansion. The application is built with Virtual Tour concept to provide detailed and interactive information about a location. The building model reconstructed into 3D allows exploration inside the building to provide an immersive experience to the user. Virtual Tour Tjong A Fie Mansion application’s trial was carried out to 10 random people and data collection was carried out by filling out the provided questionnaire. The questionnaire results obtained value of 83,6% which states this application run well, interesting, and interactive.

Fani Windari Wins 2nd Place at the AORTA Innovation Challenge

Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology Research 2021

FACULTY OF COMPUTER SCIENCE AND INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY UNIVERSITAS SUMATERA UTARA

Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology

About Us Education Research Community Service News E-Magazine Faculty News Faculty Agenda Faculty Announcement Faculty Article PPID Executive Students Organization Google Developer Student Club Chapter USU (GDSC USU)

Google Developer Student Clubs (GDSC) is the official community of Google Developer as a bridge between theory and practice for students who have an interest in developing their skills in the field of technology, especially Google Technologies. With GDSC's core values of Connect, Learn, and Grow, this community invites students to grow together through learning and expanding professional connections.

Staff Contact FACULTY OF COMPUTER SCIENCE AND INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY UNIVERSITAS SUMATERA UTARA

Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology

9 Universitas Road, Medan, North Sumatra, Indonesia 20155

mail fasilkomti@usu.ac.id (General enquiries or feedback) Sitemap Report Frequently Asked Questions Archive Website Usage Policy Website Copyright

USU Official Prospective Students Students Alumni & Careers Lecturers & Staff International Visitors Media & Partners Services Accreditation & Achievements Virtual Gallery EN expand_more Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology

About Us Education Research Community Service News E-Magazine Faculty News Faculty Agenda Faculty Announcement Faculty Article PPID Executive Students Organization Himpunan Mahasiswa Teknologi Informasi USU (HIMATIF USU)

HIMATIF USU is the student association of the Information Technology study program at the . This organization was founded on April 28, 2008 under the name Himatel, then changed its name to Himatif on September 17, 2011. Himatif is an internal organization of the University of North Sumatra, under the Student Government of the Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology, University of North Sumatra.

Staff Contact FACULTY OF COMPUTER SCIENCE AND INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY UNIVERSITAS SUMATERA UTARA

Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology

The USU Undergraduate in Computer Science Student Association (IMILKOM) was established on Sunday, August 18, 2002. The Undergraduate Computer Science Student Association (IMILKOM) is based at the Undergraduate in Computer Science Campus, Alumni Street no. 9 USU Campus Medan.

About Us Education Research Community Service News E-Magazine Faculty News Faculty Agenda Faculty Announcement Faculty Article PPID Executive Students Organization Pemerintahan Mahasiswa Fasilkom-TI USU (PEMA FASILKOM-TI)

An executive organization called Student Government of the Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology (PEMA Fasilkom-TI) USU was formed on December 21, 2012 and is based in the Fasilkom-TI USU Building, University Street No. 24 A USU Campus, Medan. PEMA Fasilkom-TI USU acts as a student representative at the faculty level, whose main function is to voice student aspirations to the faculty and university. PEMA is also responsible for organizing activities that support students' academic and non-academic development, such as seminars and workshops, and acts as a liaison between students and the faculty. In addition, PEMA is active in empowering students in various fields and advocating for academic and non-academic issues faced by students.

About Us Education Research Community Service News E-Magazine Faculty News Faculty Agenda Faculty Announcement Faculty Article PPID Executive Kampus Merdeka Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology Kuliah Kerja Nyata Tematik

Kuliah Kerja Nyata Tematik Pembelajaran Pemberdayaan Masyarakat (KKNT-PPM USU) is a form of education that provides learning experiences for students to live in rural communities. This program aims to hone the soft skills and hard skills of partnership and leadership of USU students in managing development programs in rural areas of North Sumatra Province.

More about Kuliah Kerja Nyata Tematik Wirausaha Merdeka

Wirausaha Merdeka is part of the Kampus Merdeka program of the Ministry of Education, Culture, Research, and Technology of the Republic of Indonesia that provides opportunities for students to gain learning experience through entrepreneurial activities. The Wirausaha Merdeka program collaborates with the Program Implementing Universities with the goal of providing skills for students to hone their entrepreneurial spirit, encourage increased entrepreneurial experience, and increase student employability.

More about Wirausaha Merdeka Pertukaran Mahasiswa Merdeka

Pertukaran Mahasiswa Merdeka is an exchange program that provides students with the opportunity to study for one semester at a university in Indonesia to broaden students' understanding of diversity and the spirit of unity.

More about Pertukaran Mahasiswa Merdeka Magang Bersertifikat

Magang Bersertifikat is part of the Kampus Merdeka program of the Ministry of Education, Culture, Research and Technology of the Republic of Indonesia that provides opportunities for students to gain practical work experience in industries and companies relevant to their field of study. The program is supported by partner companies and organizations as well as provides opportunities to earn certificates and academic credits. The goal is to equip students with skills and practical work experience as well as help partner companies and organizations obtain quality human resources.

More about Magang Bersertifikat Kampus Mengajar

Kampus Mengajar is a program that provides opportunities for students to engage in learning outside the classroom for a period of 1 (one) semester by becoming teacher partners to innovate in the development of creative and innovative teaching strategies and models at targeted educational units. The program focuses on enhancing students' literacy and numeracy skills in the selected schools.

More about Kampus Mengajar Studi Independen Bersertifikat

Studi Independen Bersertifikat is part of the Kampus Merdeka program of the Ministry of Education, Culture, Research, and Technology of the Republic of Indonesia that provides opportunities for students to develop themselves by learning specific and practical competencies needed in the industrial and business world. This program provides support in the form of learning modules and mentoring under the guidance of relevant mentors in their fields. Learning in the form of short courses, boot camps, and massive open online courses (MOOC) helps students practice these competencies in a real project for future career paths. Students who have passed the evaluation will obtain certification and the opportunity to be recommended to companies or partners of Studi Independen providers.

More about Studi Independen Bersertifikat Praktisi Mengajar

Praktisi Mengajar is part of the Kampus Merdeka program initiated by the Ministry of Education, Culture, Research, and Technology of the Republic of Indonesia in preparing higher education graduates to enter the world of work. Praktisi Mengajar provides a space for collaboration between lecturers and expert practitioners so an in-depth exchange of knowledge and expertise through course delivery, both offline and online, is established. Through this program, graduates are equipped with relevant knowledge and skills according to the needs and challenges in the world of work.

More about Praktisi Mengajar IISMA

The Indonesian International Student Mobility Awards (IISMA) is a scholarship scheme from the Ministry of Education, Culture, Research, and Technology of the Republic of Indonesia to provide opportunities for students through mobility programs at renowned universities abroad for one semester.

The program is a government effort to prepare qualified human resources that are relevant to the needs of industry and the world of work. This program is expected to produce graduates who not only master academic knowledge, but also have qualified skills, experience, and entrepreneurial spirit.

About Us Education Research Community Service News E-Magazine Faculty News Faculty Agenda Faculty Announcement Faculty Article PPID Executive Kuliah Kerja Nyata Tematik

Kuliah Kerja Nyata Tematik Pembelajaran Pemberdayaan Masyarakat (KKNT-PPM USU) is a form of education that provides learning experiences for students to live in rural communities. This program aims to hone the soft skills and hard skills of partnership and leadership of USU students in managing development programs in rural areas of North Sumatra Province.

Benefit Kuliah Kerja Nyata Tematik

Provide learning and working experiences to students on the application and development of science and technology outside the campus.

Adapt students to the situation and conditions of rural communities, and help them identify issues and potentials of the village while seeking solutions to enhance the village's potential to become self-reliant.

Train students to take responsibility for collaboratively applying their scientific competencies with all stakeholders of the village.

Foster a professional attitude in directly implementing community empowerment activities by collaboratively formulating Village Medium-Term Development Plans (RPJMDes), Village Annual Work Plans (RKPDes), and other strategic programs.

Gain experience and have the means to utilize science and technology and their acquired skills during their time in the village.

Gain the opportunity to collaborate with young talents and lecturers in formulating Village Medium-Term Development Plans (RPJMDes) and Village Annual Work Plans (RKPDes) as well as other strategic programs.

Gain the opportunity to reform village governance.

Promote the development of much-needed young individuals in empowering rural communities.

Increase the rural community's awareness of village development.

Accelerate rural area development.

Provide feedback to universities on the real needs of society in terms of science and technology.

Be a means for developing the three pillars of higher education and achieving key performance indicators (KPI 3, 5, 6, 7).

Serve as a platform for universities to establish networks or strategic partners in assisting village development.

Act as a means of actualizing lecturers in the development of knowledge.

Requirement Kuliah Kerja Nyata Tematik

Registered as an active student at a faculty within .

Have completed at least six semesters or obtained a minimum of 100 credits.

Include the Community Service Learning (KKN) course in the odd semester Study Plan Card (KRS) with 3 credits.

Provide an active and usable insurance membership card or letter.

Register as a participant in KKNT-PPM by filling out the registration form through the provided link.

Attach the semester 6 (Six) KRS signed by the Academic Advisor (Dosen PA).

Attend the orientation as scheduled.

Comply with the regulations and provisions set by the organizer/Community Service Institute (LPPM).

Lecturers of who have a National Lecturer Identification Number (NIDN) or Special Lecturer Identification Number (NIDK) and are not currently pursuing further studies.

Willing to become Field Supervisors.

About Us Education Research Community Service News E-Magazine Faculty News Faculty Agenda Faculty Announcement Faculty Article PPID Executive

Pertukaran Mahasiswa Merdeka is an exchange program that provides students with the opportunity to study for one semester at a university in Indonesia to broaden students' understanding of diversity and the spirit of unity.

Benefit Pertukaran Mahasiswa Merdeka Explore and learn about the diversity of Indonesian cultures Build friendships with students from various regions Opportunity to study at a different campus Requirement Pertukaran Mahasiswa Merdeka

Active students in D-3, D-4, or S-1 programs registered in the Higher Education Database (PDDikti).

At least in the 2nd semester at the time of registration.

Minimum GPA of 2.8 on a scale of 4 at the time of the PMM program registration. Students must attach the latest academic transcript during the registration process.

Must be an Indonesian citizen (WNI) and have a Population Identification Number (NIK). Students must attach scanned identification documents, such as their ID card (KTP) or Family Card (Kartu Keluarga), during registration.

Create a Statement of Absolute Responsibility (SPTJM) in accordance with the provided template on the registration page.

Have received at least the third dose of COVID-19 vaccination. Please attach a screenshot of the COVID-19 vaccination history during registration.

Physically healthy, proven by attaching a Health Certificate from an authorized healthcare facility.

Have an active bank account at BRI or BSI. Please attach a scanned copy of the student's savings book during registration.

Priority will be given to those who have BPJS Kesehatan or other health insurance that covers inpatient and outpatient care under the student's name.

About Us Education Research Community Service News E-Magazine Faculty News Faculty Agenda Faculty Announcement Faculty Article PPID Executive Praktisi Mengajar

Praktisi Mengajar is part of the Kampus Merdeka program initiated by the Ministry of Education, Culture, Research, and Technology of the Republic of Indonesia in preparing higher education graduates to enter the world of work. Praktisi Mengajar provides a space for collaboration between lecturers and expert practitioners so an in-depth exchange of knowledge and expertise through course delivery, both offline and online, is established. Through this program, graduates are equipped with relevant knowledge and skills according to the needs and challenges in the world of work.

Gain practical learning experience that is actual, relevant, beneficial, and aligned with the needs of the world of work.

Receive mentorship from expert practitioners.

Build networks with expert practitioner instructors and become aware of their potential in the world of work.

Acquire both hard skills and soft skills as a reinforcement of students' capabilities.

Support the implementation of the program for students.

Strengthen and enhance students' competencies.

Have the opportunity to collaborate with practitioners, both domestic and international, in the design and implementation of learning activities to enhance knowledge, skills, and competencies aligned with the needs of the world of work that overall support the implementation of the program at their respective universities.

Gain actualization and reference materials for learning that are directly applicable to the world of work.

Have the opportunity to apply the Three Pillars of Higher Education (Tri Dharma Perguruan Tinggi) when collaborating with practitioners from the world of work.

Enhance the university's reputation in the academic and general society.

Improve the positive assessment for BAN-PT and international accreditations.

Enhance the quality of graduates.

Gain information about the potential of students in higher education institutions who possess skills relevant to the needs of the world of work.

Obtain information about potential students who can become valuable partners in the world of work.

Educate and filter outstanding human resources at an early stage to build a talent pool.

Be part of driving the progress of education in Indonesia.

Have a minimum of 5 (five) years of experience in their field of knowledge/expertise, calculated cumulatively since graduating from at least a diploma 3 (D-3) or equivalent level of education.

Possess skills that can be taught or shared, demonstrated through a curriculum vitae (CV) and/or portfolio as follows:

Professional Practitioners: CV and Portfolio (in separate columns)

Entrepreneurial and Freelance Practitioners: CV and Company Profile or Portfolio (in separate columns)

Civil Servant Practitioners: CV and Appointment Letter

Not have, currently pursuing, or planning to obtain a National Lecturer Identification Number (NIDN), Special Lecturer Identification Number (NIDK), or Education Personnel Identification Number (NITK) during the Praktisi Mengajar program.

Not a lecturer or education personnel from any university within or outside the country.

Not currently receiving a scholarship from the Educational Fund Management Institution (LPDP).

Not involved in the management of .

The program is open to the following variety of professions:

Professionals (CEOs, Managers, Experts)

Retired Seniors/Practitioners with active skills and experience

Civil Servants (Local Government, Police, Military, Government Ministries/Agencies)

State-Owned Enterprise (BUMN) employees

The Higher Education Institution must be under the supervision of the Ministry of Education, Culture, Research, and Technology (Kemendikbudristek) and registered in the Higher Education Database (PDDikti) system.

The Higher Education Institution and Study Programs must be accredited by the National Accreditation Agency for Higher Education (BAN-PT) or the Independent Accreditation Agency (LAM) in accordance with the provisions of the laws and regulations.

Willing to collaborate with practitioners from within and outside the country for the implementation of the Praktisi Mengajar program.

Willing to assign lecturers as the Higher Education Coordinator Institution and the Lecturer Coordinator to manage the implementation of the collaborative class program.

Willing to manage the program's finances in accordance with the provisions and issue a Letter of Absolute Responsibility (SPTJM).

Issue a decree regarding the program fees at the Higher Education Institution in accordance with the standard fees set by the Ministry of Education, Culture, Research, and Technology (Kemendikbudristek).

Willing to comply with all the provisions of the Praktisi Mengajar program.

Have an active status in the PDDikti system, both at the institutional and study program levels.

Kuliah Kerja Nyata Tematik Wirausaha Merdeka Pertukaran Mahasiswa Merdeka Magang Bersertifikat Kampus Mengajar Studi Independen Bersertifikat Praktisi Mengajar IISMA More About FACULTY OF COMPUTER SCIENCE AND INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY UNIVERSITAS SUMATERA UTARA

About Us Education Research Community Service News E-Magazine Faculty News Faculty Agenda Faculty Announcement Faculty Article PPID Executive Wirausaha Merdeka

Wirausaha Merdeka is part of the Kampus Merdeka program of the Ministry of Education, Culture, Research, and Technology of the Republic of Indonesia that provides opportunities for students to gain learning experience through entrepreneurial activities. The Wirausaha Merdeka program collaborates with the Program Implementing Universities with the goal of providing skills for students to hone their entrepreneurial spirit, encourage increased entrepreneurial experience, and increase student employability.

Benefit Wirausaha Merdeka Provides practical experience for students in entrepreneurial activities through the process of equipping them with an entrepreneurial mindset and competencies, business concept development and creation as well as entrepreneurial practice and development.

Have competence in analyzing businesses and creating business opportunities.

Enhance work capabilities to improve the quality and capacity of university graduates.

Opportunities to learn outside the campus to further develop knowledge in the field of entrepreneurship.

Recognition of credits (SKS) equivalent to 20 SKS for the series of activities conducted.

Active students in the following educational levels: (a) Diploma (D-2, D-3, D-4) and Undergraduate (S-1) - at least in the 3rd semester; or (b) Master's (S-2) and Doctoral (S-3) - no semester restriction (without credit conversion).

Not currently working on a thesis or final project during the program.

Not taking any courses at their home institution while participating in the program.

Obtain a recommendation letter from the Head of the Study Program and the leader in academics of the institution.

Willing to participate in the program full-time (one semester), as indicated by a student declaration letter.

About Us Education Research Community Service News E-Magazine Faculty News Faculty Agenda Faculty Announcement Faculty Article PPID Executive Judicium Information Description

Judicium is a stage in the academic process in higher education, especially at the undergraduate level. level. Judicium usually refers to the announcement or determination of a student's graduation from the the study program he/she is enrolled in. The following is general information about judicium, although the regulations and procedures may vary between educational institutions:

Credit/Unit Completion: Students must complete all study loads or credits determined by the study program. Typically, this includes mandatory courses, electives, and a thesis or final project.

Cumulative Grade Point Average (GPA): The GPA requirement for graduation is usually set by the institution. Most colleges require a minimum GPA to ensure graduation.

Administrative Completeness: Students must complete all administrative processes, such as tuition fee payment, filling out graduation forms, and other administrative procedures.

Final Project/Thesis: If the study program requires a final project or thesis, students must complete and pass this stage.

Other Activities: Some colleges may set additional requirements, such as participation in extracurricular activities or community service programs.

Registration: Students register to participate in the graduation according to the schedule determined by the institution.

Verification of Requirements: The institution verifies the requirements that must be met by students, including the number of credits, GPA, and administrative completeness.

Graduation Examination: Usually, there is a graduation examination where students can defend their final project or give a presentation related to the research or case study they have conducted.

Graduation Decision: After the examination, the graduation committee or authorized body makes a decision on whether the student is declared pass or fail.

Announcement of Graduation: After the decision is made, the results are announced to the students, and they will receive a diploma or certificate of graduation.

Graduation Ceremony: Usually, graduation is followed by a ceremony where students formally receive their academic degrees.

About Us Education Research Community Service News E-Magazine Faculty News Faculty Agenda Faculty Announcement Faculty Article PPID Executive Building the Foundation for a Digital Future Undergraduate Program in Computer Science General Information About Academic Research & Service Alumni Activities SDGs

As a study program that has been accredited Excellent and established since 2001, the Undergraduate Program in Computer Science of (USU) has produced numerous outstanding students and created qualified computer experts spread throughout Indonesia. The program aims to teach the science of computing, hardware management, and computer software development.

Taught by experts in the field of information technology with national teaching certificates and supported by an integrated curriculum, we have a deep commitment in providing our students with an interactive education and learning experiences in the hope that they will become the best in the field of information technology, competence, and able to compete in the era of digitalization, both on a national and international scale. Graduates of our program have extensive career opportunities in various digital fields, such as software engineers, web designers, information technology consultants, and many more.

The Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology (Fasilkom-TI) of was established on September 6, 2011, with the issuance of the Decree of the Rector of USU Number 2360/UN5.1.R/SK/PRS/2011. The establishment of Fasilkom-TI USU has a long history and involves many parties. If calculated from the issuance of the permit to open a Computer Science Study Program by the Directorate General of Higher Education of the Ministry of Education and Culture of the Republic of Indonesia on November 22, 2001, until the formation of the Faculty, the time required is ten years. The first study program formed was the Undergraduate (S-1) Program in Computer Science under FMIPA USU’s auspices. The Undergraduate (S-1) Program in Computer Science was established in accordance with the Decree of the Directorate General of Higher Education Number 3551/D/T/2001 dated November 22, 2001, on permission to organize the Undergraduate (S-1) Program in Computer Science.

At the end of 2007, the Directorate General of Higher Education issued a Decree on the Structuring and Codification of Study Programs in Higher Education Institutions Number 163/KEP/DIKTI/2007 dated 27 November 2007, which, among others, regulates the naming of undergraduate (S-1) computer study programs as follows: S-1 Informatics Engineering, S-1 Computer Systems, and S-1 Information Systems. However, this naming was later refined with the issuance of the Circular Letter of the Directorate General of Higher Education Number 1030/D/T/2010. With the issuance of the Circular Letter of the Directorate General of Higher Education, higher education institutions organizing the field of computers and informatics were given the opportunity to reorganize the naming of the study programs they manage. thus re-established the name for its two study programs to become the Undergraduate (S-1) Program in Computer Science and the Undergraduate (S-1) Program in Information Technology.

arrow_back_ios_new arrow_forward_ios

To become a research-based Computer Science Study Program that is adaptive, collaborative, and creative with international standards, especially in the fields of artificial intelligence, infrastructure and security, and software engineering.

Mission remove To prepare Computer Science academicians who have the character of BINTANG (Devoted to Almighty God in the frame of diversity, Innovative and has Integrity, Resilient and Wise) and are ready to compete in the global community.

To improve Education in the field of Computer Science, especially in the areas of expertise of artificial intelligence, infrastructure and security, and software engineering.

To develop Research in the field of Computer Science and innovative technology that can contribute to Society’s quality of life in the frame of Tropical Science and Medicine, Agroindustry, Local Wisdom, Energy [sustainable], Natural Resources [biodiversity, forest marine, mine, tourism], Technology [appropriate] and Arts [ethnic] (TALENTA) USU.

To organize Community Service by utilizing information and computer technology to improve Society’s quality of life.

To establish Cooperation with graduate users on an ongoing basis in the fields of research, community service, and field work practice to improve the quality of education.

To play an active role in higher education professional organizations in the field of computer science to answer stakeholder needs.

Goals remove To produce graduates who are able to solve real problems in the field of computer science.

To produce graduates who have the core values of BINTANG (Devoted to Almighty God in the frame of diversity, Innovative and has Integrity, Resilient and Wise).

To become a study program with good governance in order to support the formation of an independent USU.

Graduates of the Undergraduate Program in Computer Science are capable of compiling scientific descriptions, having the competence to develop problem-solving models for both individual and organizational objectives by implementing computer science algorithms, designing and implementing computation-based solutions that follow the most recent development approaches, and evaluating the efficiency and effectiveness of the methods in solving problems from various points of view.

Learning Outcomes 1 Capable of identifying, analyzing, and applying his skills to solve challenges in the field of computer science

2 Mastering theoretical concepts in computer science as well as theoretical concepts in special disciplines such as information retrieval systems, computer networks, robotics, and artificial intelligence.

3 Capable of making effective decisions based on information and data analysis in the field of computer science and also providing guidance in choosing numerous alternative solutions both independently and in groups.

4 Capable of taking responsibility for their own work and being assigned responsibility for the accomplishment of organizational goals

5 Capable of creating new job prospects by developing and applying entrepreneurial models based on computer science and information technology.

USU Official Prospective Students Students Alumni & Careers Lecturers & Staff International Visitors Media & Partners Services Accreditation & Achievements Virtual Gallery EN expand_more Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology

About Us Education Research Community Service News E-Magazine Faculty News Faculty Agenda Faculty Announcement Faculty Article PPID Executive Building the Foundation for a Digital Future Undergraduate Program in Information Technology General Information About Academic Research & Service Alumni Activities SDGs

The Undergraduate Program in Information Technology focuses on developing knowledge in Data Science and Intelligent Systems to produce excellent, professional graduates with global competitiveness. The program provides an education that equips students with academic competencies, technical skills, and an understanding of ethics and professional responsibility in applying information technology. The curriculum is designed to provide a strong foundation in information technology, data analysis, artificial intelligence, server and network security, information technology infrastructure management, and multidisciplinary aspects that support the development of data-driven computing solutions. Students are also equipped with teamwork skills, effective communication, and the ability to adapt to technological advancements. In the research field, the study program encourages the development of data-driven and artificial intelligence-based innovations relevant to industry and societal needs. Additionally, the study program actively engages in community service activities by applying research findings to enhance information literacy and technology-based solutions.

Graduates of the Information Technology study program have competencies in systematically applying information technology theories and practices, developing data-driven computing solutions, fostering multidisciplinary collaboration, and building technology-based entrepreneurship.

The proposal for the establishment of the Undergraduate Program in Information Technology was submitted in early 2007 with the goal of adding one more study program within the computing discipline, in addition to the Undergraduate Program in Computer Science that had been established in 2002. However, at that time, in the nomenclature rules of the Directorate General of Higher Education (Dikti), the name Information Technology Study Program was not yet known. This study program was still confused with the name of the study program known at that time as the Informatics Study Program, which was actually another name for the Computer Science Study Program. After discussions with the Director General of Higher Education, a decree was finally issued for the establishment of the study program, but under the name of the Undergraduate Program in Software Engineering. Thus, the Undergraduate Program in Software Engineering was officially established in 2007. Through Dikti Decree No. 1629/D/T/2007 dated July 16, 2007. In the early days of its establishment, this study program was managed under the Faculty of Mathematics and Natural Sciences of (FMIPA USU). At the end of 2007, the Decree of the Director General of Higher Education No. 163/KEP/DIKTI/2007, dated November 27, 2007, on the Structuring and Codification of Study Programs in Higher Education Institutions. The naming of undergraduate (S-1) computer study programs is as follows: 1. Informatics Engineering (S-1); 2. Computer Systems (S-1); and 3. Information Systems (S-1) In this naming system, it can be seen that there is no place for the Undergraduate Programs in Computer Science and Software Engineering. Therefore, USU took the policy to adjust the naming of these two study programs to become the Undergraduate Program in Information Systems and the Undergraduate (S-1) Program in Informatics Engineering.

However, the naming system proposed by the Director General of Higher Education received challenges from various higher education institutions, especially those with computer study programs, due to the controversy that arose because many study programs were not accommodated in the new naming system. Asosiasi Perguruan Tinggi Informatika dan Komputer (APTIKOM or the Association of Informatics and Computer Higher Education Institutions) finally resolved this issue by proposing a system of naming and structuring study programs in the field of Informatics and Computers. The result was the Circular Letter of the Director General of Higher Education No. 1030/D/T/2010 on the Structuring of Nomenclature for Psychology, Communication, Computer, and Landscape Study Programs.

arrow_back_ios_new arrow_forward_ios

To become a superior and professional study program in the development of knowledge in the field of Information Technology with emphasis on Data Science and Intelligent System to produce graduates with global competitiveness.

Mission remove To organize education with excellent academic competence and professionalism in mastering the field of Information Technology that is specialized in the fields of Data Science and Intelligent System.

To organize and develop research and dissemination of research results through planned, innovative, and quality scientific publications in accordance with global developments in the fields of Data Science and Intelligent System.

To improve information literacy in society through the application of research results, service, and cooperation to elements of society.

Strengthening cooperation and collaboration across multidisciplinary and multicultural fields through the implementation of the Tri Dharma of higher education.

Goals remove To implement a Competency-Based Curriculum in accordance with the Graduate Profiles to improve the quality of innovative learning management in the Information Technology Study Program, especially in the fields of Data Science and Intelligent System.

To produce graduates who are professional, devoted, innovative, resilient, competent, have a culture of research, have achievements, and have competitive abilities in the field of Information Technology at national and international levels.

To produce research that is innovative, follows technological developments, is community-based, has good scientific ethics in terms of quality and quantity, and is disseminated through scientific papers both nationally and internationally specialized in the fields of Data Science and Intelligent Systems.

To produce research that raises local potential related to culture and history packaged in the form of information technology and disseminated through scientific papers both nationally and internationally.

To organize services, community service activities, and cooperation with the scientific community within the scope of international, university, government, private, and society through the utilization of research laboratories, the channeling of scientific literacy, community problem solving on an ongoing basis in the fields of Data Science and Intelligent System.

To organize community service in the field of information technology that can increase knowledge and open business opportunities for society.

To increase institutional cooperation of Study Programs in the field of Education at national and international levels.

To increase institutional cooperation of Study Programs in the field of Research at national and international levels.

To increase institutional cooperation of Study Programs in the field of Community Service at national and international levels.

Here are the study fees Undergraduate Program in Information Technology

Undergraduate Program SNBP & SNBT Pathway UKT Group I IDR 500,000 UKT Group II IDR 1,000,000 UKT Group III IDR 2,400,000 UKT Group IV IDR 3,100,000 UKT Group V IDR 4,700,000 UKT Group VI IDR 5,400,000 UKT Group VII IDR 7,700,000 UKT Group VIII IDR 10,000,000 Undergraduate Program Institutional Development Fee S(Independent Program Only) IDR 15,000,000 One-Time Payment Undergraduate Program International Mandiri Pathway IDR 37,500,000 Per student for 1 semester

Information Technology graduates are able to adapt to innovative Information Technology developments and make decisions on issues in the Information Technology field by identifying and analyzing computational requirements based on the results of a comprehensive analysis of information and data. Using current methodologies, techniques, expertise, tools, and techniques, identifying, analyzing, designing, implementing, and managing problems related to the application of Information Technology. This is done by integrating knowledge related to information technology and computer principles, using effective and efficient algorithms or methods. Maintaining BINTANG values and standards while improving the quality of life of the nation and state.

Learning Outcomes 1 Capable of maintaining an attitude of upholding principles and norms in carrying out responsibilities to improve the nation's and state's quality of life

2 Capable of applying BINTANG values (Fearing God Almighty in the framework of diversity, Innovative with integrity, Tough and Wise)

3 Capable of using logical, analytical, and systematic thinking to fulfill the demands of individuals or organizations and adapting to the development of innovative and fast-moving information technology.

4 Capable of communicating effectively and responsibly to professionals and the general public, both orally and in writing, in transmitting or presenting ideas and well-organized research results.

5 Capable of applying the spirit of responsible leadership, teamwork, entrepreneurship, and independence and collaborating in multidisciplinary and multi-cultural work groups.

6 Capable of making appropriate decisions in the framework of problem-solving in their field of competence based on the outcomes of information and data analysis and effective communication procedures

7 Capable of identifying, analyzing, designing, implementing, and managing the application of information technology using the most recent approaches, techniques, expertise, and tools.

8 Capable of implementing intelligent systems and data science in a specific platform environment to resolve real-world problems using information technology aspects

9 Capable of solving problems by combining qualified knowledge of the functioning principles of information technology and computers with effective and efficient algorithms or methods

The Study Programs research roadmap includes analysis of recent trends, identification of research gaps, and new research opportunities. The next step is to develop research collaborations, improve infrastructure, funding, and researcher capacity. The goal is to ensure the relevance and contribution of the Study Program in solving complex problems in its field of study.

Di Fakultas Ilmu Komputer dan Teknologi Informasi, kami mendorong kolaborasi dengan pihak lain untuk inovasi yang lebih besar dan berdampak.

22 May 2025 Fasilkom-TITerima Fasilitas CSR Wifi Corner dari PT Pertamina Gas Negara

Fasilkom-TI USU menerima fasilitas CSR Wifi Corner dari PT Pertamina Gas Negara untuk mendukung kegiatan akademik dan akses internet sivitas kampus.

06 May 2025 Kunjungan Class Visit SMAS Sukma Bangsa Lhokseumawe ke Fasilkom-TI USU

Fasilkom-TI USU menerima kunjungan 105 siswa SMAS Sukma Bangsa Lhokseumawe untuk mengenal jurusan, suasana perkuliahan, dan fasilitas pendidikan teknologi informasi.

05 May 2025 Menuju Kampus Bersih dan Berintegritas: Fasilkom-TI USU Gaungkan Semangat Zona Integritas

Fasilkom-TI USU gelar sosialisasi Zona Integritas untuk wujudkan kampus bersih, bebas korupsi, dan berintegritas bersama Cholina Trisa Siregar sebagai narasumber.

15 Apr 2025 Fasilkom-TI USU Gelar Pelatihan Layanan Publik Prima bagi Tenaga Kependidikan

Fasilkom-TI USU mengadakan Pelatihan Layanan Publik Prima untuk meningkatkan kompetensi tenaga kependidikan dalam memberikan pelayanan optimal, profesional, dan berorientasi pada kepuasan pengguna.

22 Jan 2025 Tim Rodent Watch USU Raih Juara di Asia-Pacific Global Health Innovation Hackathon 2025

Tim Rodent Watch USU raih juara Asia-Pacific Health Hackathon 2025 dengan inovasi AI lintas disiplin untuk prediksi dan pencegahan penyakit zoonosis secara global.

12 Dec 2024 Fasilkom-TI USU Borong Penghargaan Bergengsi di USU Awards 2024

Fasilkom-TI USU meraih berbagai penghargaan di USU Awards 2024, mencakup prestasi mahasiswa internasional, nasional, dan akreditasi unggul, menunjukkan komitmen menuju keunggulan.

- - schedule N/A - N/A place Tidak Ada Data Yang Tersedia Tentang Kami

Fakultas Ilmu Komputer dan Teknologi Informasi USU adalah institusi terkemuka yang didedikasikan untuk keunggulan dalam pendidikan dan penelitian. Fakultas ini membekali mahasiswa dengan pengetahuan pengetahuan, mendorong inovasi untuk karir yang sukses di era digital dan berkontribusi secara signifikan terhadap kemajuan teknologi regional.

Selengkapnya Tentang Kami Fakultas Ilmu Komputer dan Teknologi Informasi didirikan pada

2011 1320 Mahasiswa Aktif 5 Program Studi 5 Guru Besar 5 Lektor Kepala 645 Hak atas Kekayaan Intelektual 926 Publikasi 14 Mahasiswa Masuk 3 Mahasiswa Pertukaran 5 Kelompok Penelitian 21 Asisten Profesor 14 Laboratorium 3 Jurnal dan Konferensi

Atas nama staf fakultas dan staf pengajar, saya dengan senang hati menyambut Anda di Fakultas Ilmu Komputer dan Teknologi Informasi (Fasilkom-TI) .

Di Fakultas Ilmu Komputer dan Teknologi Informasi , kami telah menyediakan pendidikan dan penelitian berkualitas tinggi dan berkelas dunia sejak tahun 2012, serta melayani kebutuhan bangsa akan sumber daya manusia yang berpendidikan tinggi, yang diharapkan memiliki kemampuan untuk mengantisipasi dan beradaptasi dengan kebutuhan Indonesia Emas 2045.

Dr. Maya Silvi Lydia B.Sc., M.Sc.

Program Sarjana Fasilkom-TI menyediakan dua program sarjana Program Magister Fasilkom-TI menyediakan dua program magister Program Doktoral Fasilkom-TI menyediakan satu program doktoral Menyambut Tamu Internasional

Jelajahi komunitas akademik yang dinamis di universitas kami, yang menyambut mahasiswa internasional dengan tangan terbuka. Rangkullah lingkungan belajar yang dinamis di mana latar belakang yang beragam memperkaya pengalaman pendidikan. Bergabunglah dengan kami dalam membina pertukaran budaya dan pemahaman saat kami membangun komunitas global yang saling mendukung. Selamat datang dalam perjalanan pendidikan yang inklusif di universitas kami.

Lebih lanjut tentang Program Internasional Penerimaan Mahasiswa Baru di Fakultas Ilmu Komputer dan Teknologi Informasi

Fakultas Ilmu Komputer dan Teknologi Informasi menerima mahasiswa baru mahasiswa baru untuk Semester 1 Tahun Akademik 2024/2025 untuk semua program studi pada jenjang sarjana, magister, dan doktoral. Cari tahu lebih lanjut tentang penerimaan mahasiswa baru pada tautan berikut ini.

09 Aug 2024 Penelitian 30 Aug 2024 Fani Windari, mahasiswi USU, meraih juara 2 AORTA Innovation Challenge 2024, mengharumkan nama universitas dan menginspirasi inovasi kesehatan di kalangan mahasiswa.

27 Jun 2024 Pengabdian 14 Oct 2021 Data Pengabdian kepada Masyarakat Fasilkom-TI pada 2017 Data Pengabdian kepada Masyarakat pada 2017 arrow_forward_ios Lebih lanjut tentang Penelitian Komunitas

arrow_back_ios arrow_forward_ios

Fakultas Ilmu Komputer dan Teknologi Informasi menawarkan berbagai laboratorium dan fasilitas untuk mendukung studi dan penelitian Anda.

Selengkapnya tentang Laboratorium dan Fasilitas Laboratorium Data Science, Smart System, and Software laboratorium Laboratorium ini, terletak di Gedung D Ilmu Komputer, merupakan salah satu laboratorium penelitian yang digunakan mahasiswa untuk mengerjakan tugas akhir maupun penelitian yang berbasis Software, komputasi data, dll.

arrow_forward Laboratorium Computer System, Network, and Security laboratorium Laboratorium ini, terletak di Gedung D Ilmu Komputer, merupakan salah satu dari laboratorium penelitian tugas akhir yang dipakai mahasiswa untuk mengerjakan tugas akhir dan melakukan penelitian yang berbasis jaringan, sistem komputer, dan keamanan komputer.

arrow_forward Laboratorium Computer Vision and Multimedia laboratorium Laboratorium ini berletak di Gedung C Teknologi Informasi yang merupakan salah satu dari laboratorium penelitian tugas akhir yang berfungsi untuk meneliti bidang Computer Vision seperti AR (augmented reality) yang menggunakan HoloLens dan VR (virtual reality) yang menggunakan Oculus, Meta Quest, dll.

Cari tahu selengkapnya tentang Fakultas Ilmu Komputer dan Teknologi Informasi .

09 September 2022 Eksplor Agenda FASILKOMTI expand_more Edisi 2025 Baca Sekarang FAKULTAS ILMU KOMPUTER DAN TEKNOLOGI INFORMASI UNIVERSITAS SUMATERA UTARA

Tentang Pendidikan Penelitian Pengabdian Berita E-Magazine Berita Fakultas Agenda Fakultas Pengumuman Fakultas Artikel Fakultas PPID Pelaksana Konferensi Internasional ke-6 tentang Komputasi dan Informatika Terapan (ICCAI) 2022

Konferensi Internasional Fasilkom-TI dengan tema A New World of Research: Sustainable Research in a Digital World

Pemberitahuan Acara: Buku Abstrak Konferensi tersedia melalui tautan ini

Tema: "Dunia Penelitian yang Baru: Penelitian Berkelanjutan di Dunia Digital"

Kejadian pandemi baru-baru ini telah mengubah kehidupan kita secara signifikan. Kita dituntut untuk merangkul norma-norma baru dan standar baru dalam cara hidup kita. Untuk melakukan transformasi ini, penelitian memainkan peran penting untuk memperkenalkan inovasi baru untuk mempercepat proses tersebut. Namun, merencanakan dan melakukan penelitian yang berkelanjutan dalam lingkungan yang terus berubah ini juga merupakan sebuah tantangan. Para peneliti dituntut untuk mengadaptasi cara mereka dalam melakukan kolaborasi dan komunikasi. Dalam perubahan ini, kami telah memperkenalkan beberapa inovasi seperti konsep, metode, dan alat, untuk mempertahankan penelitian yang berkelanjutan.

Fakultas Ilmu Komputer dan Teknologi Informasi, , mengundang semua peneliti untuk mempresentasikan karya mereka dalam The 6th International Confrence on Computing and Applied Informatics 2022. Tujuan kami adalah untuk menyediakan lingkungan di mana para peneliti yang berpartisipasi dapat berkomunikasi, berdiskusi, dan berkolaborasi dalam acara ini. Dalam konferensi ini, para peneliti diundang untuk berbagi penelitian dan inovasi mereka serta pengalaman dan tantangan dalam mempertahankan penelitian yang berkelanjutan di lingkungan yang terus berubah.

Tentang Pendidikan Penelitian Pengabdian Berita E-Magazine Berita Fakultas Agenda Fakultas Pengumuman Fakultas Artikel Fakultas PPID Pelaksana Akreditasi & Prestasi Fakultas Ilmu Komputer dan Teknologi Informasi Kualitas Unggul, SDM Berkualifikasi Fakultas Ilmu Komputer dan Teknologi Informasi menempatkan peningkatan kualitas sumber daya manusia sebagai prioritas utama. Dalam upaya mewujudkan komitmen ini, FASILKOM-TI telah berhasil meraih akreditasi, yang merupakan pengakuan atas standar kualitas pendidikan dan pelayanan. Akreditasi ini tidak hanya mencerminkan komitmen fakultas terhadap penyediaan pendidikan berkualitas tetapi juga menunjukkan fokus pada pengembangan kompetensi dan keterampilan mahasiswa.

Fakultas Ilmu Komputer dan Teknologi Informasi

USU Official Calon Mahasiswa Mahasiswa Alumni & Karir Dosen & Staff International Visitors Media & Mitra Layanan Akreditasi & Prestasi Virtual Gallery ID expand_more Fakultas Ilmu Komputer dan Teknologi Informasi

Tentang Pendidikan Penelitian Pengabdian Berita E-Magazine Berita Fakultas Agenda Fakultas Pengumuman Fakultas Artikel Fakultas PPID Pelaksana Alumni dan Karir Fakultas Ilmu Komputer dan Teknologi Informasi Alumni Yang Bijak, Pasti Isi Tracer Study Tracer Study akan memberikan informasi mengenai hasil penelusuran karir dan kehidupan para alumni setelah mereka lulus dari universitas. Hal ini sangat berguna bagi calon mahasiswa untuk mengetahui seberapa sukses para alumni dalam mencapai karir mereka dan bagaimana pengalaman mereka selama kuliah dapat membantu dalam mencapai tujuan tersebut. Selain itu, Tracer Study juga membantu universitas dalam meningkatkan kualitas pendidikan dan memperbaiki program-program yang telah disediakan sehingga dapat lebih mempersiapkan siswa-siswa untuk memasuki dunia kerja. Dengan adanya Tracer Study, universitas dapat memperoleh umpan balik yang berharga dari para alumni yang dapat digunakan sebagai bahan evaluasi dan perbaikan bagi program-program yang telah disediakan.

menyediakan berbagai sistem informasi yang berguna untuk alumni dalam mempermudah menjalankan kegiatan dan memperoleh informasi kealumnian.

> Berita > Alibaba Cloud Laksanakan Workshop Memahami Dunia Cloud Computing di Fasilkom-TI USU

Alibaba Cloud Laksanakan Workshop Memahami Dunia Cloud Computing di Fasilkom-TI USU

Thumbnail Alibaba Cloud Laksanakan Workshop Memahami Dunia Cloud Computing di Fasilkom-TI USU

Alibaba Cloud telah menyelenggarakan workshop Memahami Dunia Cloud Computing di Fakultas Ilmu Komputer dan Teknologi Informasi (Fasilkom-TI) (USU). Workshop ini diselenggarakan di Aula Fakultas Ekonomi dan Bisnis (FEB) USU pada hari Rabu, 13 September 2022.

Alibaba Cloud telah menyelenggarakan workshop Memahami Dunia Cloud Computing di Fakultas Ilmu Komputer dan Teknologi Informasi (Fasilkom-TI) (USU). Workshop ini diselenggarakan di Aula Fakultas Ekonomi dan Bisnis (FEB) USU pada hari Rabu, 13 September 2022.

Alibaba Cloud merupakan tulang punggung teknologi digital dan intelijen dari Alibaba Group, dan salah satu dari tiga penyedia IaaS (Infrastructure as a Service) terkemuka di dunia. Alibaba Cloud juga merupakan penyedia layanan cloud publik terbesar di Tiongkok. Saat ini Alibaba Cloud memiliki 3 Pusat Data (Data Center) dan 1 Scrubbing Center di Indonesia. Workshop ini merupakan salah satu bentuk dukungan dan kerjasama Fasilkom-TI terhadap Alibaba Cloud.

Workshop diawali dengan pembukaan oleh MC (Master Ceremony) dilanjutkan dengan sambutan dari Dekan Fasilkom-TI, Dr. Maya Silvi Lydia, B.Sc, M.Sc. dalam sambutannya, Dekan Fasilkom-TI menyampaikan bahwa dengan hadirnya komputasi awan dapat membantu pengambilan keputusan dari data yang besar menjadi efisien dengan skala prioritas yang tinggi. Beliau juga menambahkan bahwa kegiatan ini merupakan langkah awal untuk kerja sama dengan Alibaba Cloud.

Kemudian dilanjutkan dengan pemaparan materi oleh Aaron Berliano Handoko, yaitu Marketing Technical Manager Alibaba Cloud Indonesia. Pemaparan materi diawali dengan pengenalan dan penerapan cloud computing dalam kehidupan sehari-hari. Materi dilanjutkan dengan pengenalan Alibaba Cloud dan apa saja produk-produknya. Para peserta yang hadir mendapatkan sertifikat dari Alibaba Cloud.

Berita Temukan Berita Lainnya Berita

> Berita > Asesmen Lapangan Akreditasi Program Studi Magister Sains Data dan Kecerdasan Buatan

Asesmen Lapangan Akreditasi Program Studi Magister Sains Data dan Kecerdasan Buatan

Thumbnail Asesmen Lapangan Akreditasi Program Studi Magister Sains Data dan Kecerdasan Buatan

Fasilkom-TI USU melaksanakan asesmen lapangan akreditasi Program Studi Magister Sains Data dan Kecerdasan Buatan oleh LAM INFOKOM pada 20-21 Maret 2023, melibatkan evaluasi komprehensif dan wawancara.

Medan, Humas Fasilkom-TI - Fakultas Ilmu Komputer dan Teknologi Informasi (Fasilkom-TI) (USU) melaksanakan asesmen lapangan akreditasi Program Studi Magister Sains Data dan Kecerdasan Buatan pada Senin dan Selasa, 20-21 Maret 2023 di Ruang Seminar Gedung E Fasilkom-TI.

Asesmen lapangan akreditasi dilakukan oleh Lembaga Akreditasi Mandiri Informatika dan Komputer (LAM INFOKOM). Kegiatan dibuka oleh Master of Ceremony (MC), kata sambutan oleh Dekan Fasilkom-TI Dr. Maya Silvi Lydia, B.Sc., M.Sc., kata sambutan oleh Wakil Rektor 3 USU Dr. Poppy Anjelisa Zaitun Hasibuan., S.Si, M.Si., Apt., dan kata sambutan oleh perwakilan tim asesor LAM-INFOKOM Ir. Wahyu Catur Wibowo, M.Sc., Ph.D., dan Dr. Ir. R. Rizal Isnanto, S.T., M.M., M.T., IPU, ASEAN Eng.

Dalam kata sambutannya, Dr. Ir. R. Rizal Isnanto, S.T., M.M., M.T., IPU, ASEAN Eng., mengatakan bahwa LAM-INFOKOM menggunakan lima proses dalam menilai suatu program studi yaitu, penetapan, pelaksanaan, evaluasi, pengendalian, dan peningkatan. Ia juga menambahkan bahwa dengan adanya asesmen lapangan akreditasi ini baik dari Fasilkom-TI dan LAM-INFOKOM sama-sama belajar dalam meningkatkan kualitas program studi. Kegiatan selanjutnya adalah penandatanganan berita acara asesmen lapangan akreditasi, pengunjungan ruang kelas, ruang dosen, laboratorium, dan sarana prasarana serta membahas kriteria A, B, C1-C9, D, dan E.

Pada hari kedua, kegiatan dilanjutkan dengan mewawancarai dosen, tenaga kependidikan, mahasiswa, alumni, dan pengguna lulusan. Selanjutnya, penyerahan draf berita acara asesmen lapangan kepada pimpinan Unit Pengelola Program Studi (UPPS) untuk direviu dan diakhiri dengan penandatanganan berita acara asesmen lapangan dan penyampaian umpan balik serta saran pembinaan.

Berita Temukan Berita Lainnya Berita

> Berita > Asesmen Lapangan Akreditasi Program Studi S3 Ilmu Komputer

Asesmen Lapangan Akreditasi Program Studi S3 Ilmu Komputer Dipublikasi Pada

Thumbnail Asesmen Lapangan Akreditasi Program Studi S3 Ilmu Komputer

Fasilkom-TI USU mengadakan asesmen akreditasi S3 Ilmu Komputer oleh LAM INFOKOM pada 18-19 November 2022, melibatkan kunjungan fasilitas dan wawancara.

Medan, Humas Fasilkom-TI – Fakultas Ilmu Komputer dan Teknologi Informasi (Fasilkom-TI) (USU) melakukan asesmen lapangan akreditasi Program Studi S3 Ilmu Komputer pada 18-19 November 2022 di Gedung Seminar Data Sains dan Kecerdasan Buatan Fasilkom-TI.

Asesmen lapangan akreditasi dilakukan oleh Lembaga Akreditasi Mandiri Informatika dan Komputer (LAM INFOKOM). Kegiatan dibuka oleh Master Ceremony (MC), dilanjutkan dengan kata sambutan Wakil Rektor IV Prof. Dr. Opim Salim Sitompul, M.Sc, Dekan Fasilkom-TI Dr. Maya Silvi Lydia, B.Sc., M.Sc, dan tim asesor LAM INFOKOM, Agus Harjoko, Ph.D dan Prof. Dr. Kusrini, M.Kom.

Dalam kata sambutannya, Prof. Dr. Kusrini, M.Kom, mengatakan bahwa penilaian LAM INFOKOM berdasarkan standar yang sudah ditentukan oleh fakultas. “Berbeda dengan penilaian BAN-PT, setelah itu kita fokus terhadap apa yang sudah tercapai dan apa yang akan dilakukan setelahnya,” ujarnya. Setelah itu, kegiatan dilanjutkan dengan mengunjungi ruang kelas, ruang dosen, laboratorium, dan sarana prasarana, kemudian membahas kriteria A, B, C1-C9, D, dan E.

Pada hari kedua, kegiatan dilanjutkan dengan mewawancarai dosen, tenaga kependidikan, mahasiswa, alumni, dan pengguna lulusan. Selanjutnya, penyerahan draf berita acara asesmen lapangan kepada pimpinan Unit Pengelola Program Studi (UPPS) untuk direviu dan diakhiri dengan penandatanganan berita acara asesmen lapangan dan penyampaian umpan balik serta saran pembinaan.

Berita Temukan Berita Lainnya Berita

Fasilkom-TITerima Fasilitas CSR Wifi Corner dari PT Pertamina Gas Negara
